	* Multiple appendages facilitate holding several garnishes simultaneously.

* The pick's construction allows for customization and variation.
	* Appendages can vary in length, curvature, and cross-sectional shape.
	* The pick may include sub-appendages branching from the main appendages.
	* The overall design can be asymmetric and made from a combination of materials for enhanced functionality.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to cardiac assist systems, specifically a device combining a cardiomyostimulator with a cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator.  
    • This system aims to enhance cardiac output for patients with chronic deficiencies.  
• Cardiomyoplasty utilizes surgically modified muscle tissue, like the latissimus dorsi, to assist heart contractions.  
    • The muscle tissue is stimulated in synchrony with the heart to improve stroke volume.  
• Patients with cardiomyoplasty are at risk for life-threatening arrhythmias, necessitating reliable detection and treatment.  
    • Existing systems may struggle with sensing cardiac events due to muscle stimulation interference.  
• The invention proposes an algorithm that inhibits muscle stimulation during arrhythmias to improve detection accuracy.  
    • It allows for simultaneous cardiac assistance and arrhythmia therapy, minimizing cardiac output compromise.  
• The system features programmable detection intervals and therapy responses based on detected arrhythmias.  
    • This flexibility enhances the device's adaptability to individual patient needs and arrhythmia types.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to an accommodating intraocular lens (IOL) device.
    • The IOL is designed for implantation in a subject's eye lens chamber.
    • It addresses both cataracts and presbyopia, which are common in aging populations.
    • The device consists of two lens portions: an accommodative lens and a base lens.
    • The first lens portion provides most of the accommodative power.
    • The second lens portion provides the necessary corrective refractive power.
    • The IOL can change shape or position in response to ciliary muscle activity.
    • Various design features enhance the IOL's ability to accommodate and correct vision.

• The IOL includes specific structural and material characteristics.
    • The first lens is elastically deformable, while the base lens is rigid.
    • The device may incorporate a gel or fluid to optimize refractive properties.
    • The design allows for a range of accommodation, potentially up to 15 diopters.
    • The IOL can be filled with a fluid or gel before or after implantation.
</summary>

<summary>
• This application is a continuation-in-part of a prior application (Ser. No. 07/589,995).
    • It relates to esophageal electrodes for heart stimulation.
    • The electrode can be inserted into the esophagus and stomach.
    • It aims to enhance procedures like defibrillation and pacing.
    • The invention is designed for non-invasive use, improving efficiency.
    
• The esophageal-stomach displacement electrode is described in detail.
    • It includes a semi-rigid plastic tube with a distal electrode.
    • The tube can bend to press against the stomach wall.
    • A control mechanism allows for precise positioning of the electrode.
    • The design minimizes the electrical energy needed for heart control.

• The electrode's mechanism involves a pin and cords for bending.
    • The pin is positioned parallel to the tube's axis.
    • Cords extend from the pin to a control mechanism outside the mouth.
    • The mechanism allows for easy adjustment of the electrode's position.
    • The tube can return to its original shape after use.

• The electrode is used in conjunction with an external chest electrode.
    • It is inserted through the mouth or nasal passage.
    • The operator can adjust the electrode's position for optimal contact.
    • The procedure is designed to be quick and efficient.
    • The invention aims to reduce the need for invasive procedures.

• The invention is adaptable for various medical applications.
    • It can be modified without departing from its core principles.
    • Multiple electrodes can be incorporated into the design.
    • The device can be used for different types of heart-related procedures.
    • It emphasizes non-invasive techniques for patient care.

• The detailed description includes figures illustrating the device.
    • Figures show the electrode's position and bending mechanism.
    • The design allows for easy visualization of the procedure.
    • The figures help in understanding the operational aspects.
    • They provide a clear representation of the invention's functionality.

• The invention aims to improve patient outcomes in emergency care.
    • It offers a convenient solution for ventricular pacing.
    • The electrode's design enhances the effectiveness of heart control.
    • It reduces the time and complexity of traditional methods.
    • The approach is intended to be user-friendly for medical personnel.

• The scope of the invention is defined by the appended claims.
    • Modifications can be made without losing the essence of the invention.
    • The claims will determine the legal boundaries of the patent.
    • The invention is not limited to the

<summary>
• The invention is a board game with a lake theme.  
	• It includes a playing board, tokens, title deed cards, game pieces, scrip, and movement elements.  
• The game simulates life at a lake through property acquisition and management.  
	• Players can buy, sell, mortgage, and improve properties like lake areas and boat dealerships.  
• The game board consists of contiguous spaces representing various lake-related properties.  
	• Properties are grouped by color, and players can earn rental income from owned properties.  
• Players use scrip money to conduct transactions and manage their properties.  
	• The game starts with each player receiving an equal amount of scrip, typically $1,500.  
• Special cards introduce random events that can affect players positively or negatively.  
	• Players draw from Makin A Wake and Sunken Chest card piles when landing on specific spaces.  
• The objective is to bankrupt opponents by imposing rental fees and penalties.  
	• Play continues until only one player remains solvent, declaring them the winner.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device and method for tissue treatment and regeneration.
	*  It addresses chronic open wounds that cannot be sutured.
	*  Current treatments often require prolonged care and reconstructive surgery.
	*  The device aims to improve healing through fluid supply and suctioning.

* Existing dressings have limitations in fluid supply and suctioning.
	*  Active dressings can improve healing but are not effective for deeper wounds.
	*  Hydrostatic pressure and blockage can hinder fluid transport.
	*  Current devices lack reliable methods for intermittent fluid administration.

* The invention proposes a new apparatus to minimize hydrostatic pressure.
	*  A fluid reservoir is positioned to neutralize flow resistance.
	*  The system allows for continuous suctioning while administering treatment fluid.
	*  It includes a level meter for accurate positioning of the fluid bag.

* An injection port is designed for administering fluids during suctioning.
	*  The port prevents air entry and maintains vacuum during injections.
	*  It allows for even distribution of fluids over the wound surface.
	*  The design includes an elastic membrane to maintain occlusion.

* A drainage port device is introduced to enhance suctioning efficiency.
	*  It features an open grid to prevent blockage by biological material.
	*  This increases the area exposed to suctioning, prolonging dressing function.
	*  The design aims to improve the removal of debris and particles.

* The apparatus can detect and warn of bleeding during treatment.
	*  It uses a scale to measure fluid weight in a canister.
	*  The system alerts when fluid formation rates exceed baseline levels.
	*  This feature enhances patient safety during suctioning.

* The invention includes various embodiments for fluid administration and monitoring.
	*  It allows for automated adjustments based on wound height.
	*  The system can be adapted for self-assembly and ease of use.
	*  It incorporates sensors for monitoring fluid flow and pressure.

* Methods for tissue regeneration and treatment are outlined.
	*  They emphasize minimizing hydrostatic pressure and maintaining suction.
	*  Fluid supply rates and loading doses are specified for effective treatment.
	*  The methods can be applied continuously or intermittently based on needs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application claims priority from several U.S. provisional applications and is a continuation-in-part of a previous application.
	* It relates to gravity-driven vehicles, particularly downhill racing carts that are maneuverable and stable.
* The invention features a vehicle that can be ridden in a prone position and is designed for varied terrains.
	* It includes at least two wheels or skis, a braking system, and a suspension mechanism for precise control.
* The background discusses existing patents that do not meet the objectives of the current invention.
	* Previous designs require riders to sit upright and lack the innovative features of the new vehicle.
* The invention aims to provide a steerable gravity-driven vehicle with specific performance characteristics.
	* Key features include independent steering, shock absorption, and safety mechanisms for rider protection.
* The vehicle can be retrofitted with components to enhance its performance on snow or other surfaces.
	* It may include skis, slide pans, or a combination of both for improved maneuverability.
* The design incorporates advanced suspension systems for stability and control during operation.
	* This includes air/oil shocks and hydraulic braking systems for effective deceleration.
* The vehicle's construction utilizes lightweight materials for durability and performance.
	* The body is made from fiberglass with aluminum inserts for strength and impact resistance.
* Safety features include a harness system and automatic brakes that engage if the rider falls off.
	* Additional components may include a roll bar and tow attachment for ski lifts.
* The invention is adaptable for various terrains and can be modified for winter use with skis or studded tires.
	* The design allows for easy conversion between summer and winter configurations.
* The overall goal is to create a versatile, high-performance gravity-driven vehicle for recreational use.
	* The invention emphasizes rider safety, control, and comfort while navigating downhill terrains.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a wave-based imaging method and apparatus utilizing Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography (RRDT) for improved imaging of vascular structures, particularly for characterizing vulnerable plaque in arteries.
	* The method involves directing energy waves radially outward and processing the received scattered waves using a wave-based algorithm to produce detailed images and assess plaque risk.
	* The apparatus includes a flexible catheter with a transmitter and multiple receivers capable of rotating to capture comprehensive data from various angles.

* The invention also incorporates Hilbert space inverse wave (HSIW) techniques to enhance image reconstruction and resolution, applicable in both medical imaging and non-destructive evaluations of materials.
	* The HSIW algorithm allows for the mapping of angular locations and frequency parameters, improving the identification of buried wastes and tracking underground contaminants.
	* The system is designed to operate across a range of frequencies, making it versatile for various applications, including intravascular imaging and borehole assessments.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a biological oil composition derived from marine copepods, specifically Calanus finmarchicus, aimed at preventing or treating cardiovascular diseases.  
	• The oil composition is rich in eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), and stearidonic acid (SDA), and differs significantly from traditional fish and krill oils in chemical composition.  
• Research indicates that the copepod oil composition has a unique ability to inhibit atherosclerotic plaque formation compared to concentrated EPA/DHA preparations.  
	• Experimental studies on ApoE-deficient mice showed significant reductions in plaque formation and total cholesterol levels with the copepod oil.  
• The copepod oil is characterized by a high content of wax esters and low viscosity, making it a free-flowing liquid at room temperature.  
	• The composition may contain up to 100% wax esters, with specific percentages of SDA, EPA, and DHA tailored for therapeutic use.  
• The invention includes dietary supplements, functional foods, and pharmaceutical formulations based on the biological oil composition for cardiovascular health.  
	• These formulations can be provided in various forms, including capsules and emulsions, and may contain additional pharmaceutically acceptable additives.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pharmacological compositions using polyelectrolyte complexes.
	* These complexes can incorporate active substances like peptides, proteins, and vaccines.
	* They can be used in ultrasonic diagnostic aids as contrast agents.
	* The compositions aim to enhance biodistribution and bioavailability of pharmaceuticals.

* Polyelectrolyte complexes exhibit high active substance incorporation capacities.
	* Capacities of over 90% can be achieved in microparticles.
	* Fine particles in the μm range can be formed instead of agglomerated masses.
	* Release of active substances can be controlled through complex composition.

* Preferred materials for polyelectrolyte complexes include biocompatible and biodegradable polymers.
	* Polyacids and polybases are used as partners in complex formation.
	* Hydrophobic derivatives of these polymers are particularly suitable.
	* The size of microparticles can be adjusted for various pharmaceutical applications.

* The preparation of polyelectrolyte complexes can be achieved through multiple methods.
	* Active substances can be entrapped, absorbed, chemically bound, or used as complex partners.
	* The process involves mixing acidic and basic polymer solutions.
	* The resulting complexes can be precipitated in microparticulate form.

* Various examples demonstrate the application of polyelectrolyte complexes.
	* Examples include vaccine preparations and incorporation of cytostatics like daunorubicin.
	* Microparticles can be tailored for specific release profiles and therapeutic indices.
	* The formulations can protect proteins and enhance their release characteristics.

* The invention also covers the use of polyelectrolyte complexes in wound ointments and as contrast agents.
	* These microparticles can contain antibiotics or regeneration-promoting proteins.
	* They are suitable for ultrasonic diagnosis as echogenic contrast agents.
	* The particles can pass through small capillaries unhindered.

* Release tests show controlled release profiles for incorporated substances.
	* Different active substances exhibit varying release rates over time.
	* The release can be monitored using methods like electrophoresis and UV spectroscopy.
	* Results indicate the potential for sustained therapeutic effects from the formulations.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
    * A golf ball teeing device allows golfers to insert a tee and ball without bending over.
    * Designed for elderly golfers or those with back or knee issues.
    * Prior devices are complex, heavy, and cumbersome.
    * The invention aims to simplify the process and improve portability.

* Advantages of the Invention
    * Eliminates the need for a manual unclamping mechanism.
    * Utilizes a golf club as the handle, reducing weight and size.
    * Lightweight and compact, fitting easily in a golf bag.
    * Allows for quick and efficient teeing and retrieval of the golf tee.

* Description of the Device
    * Comprises a housing with a delayed urging means to hold the ball and tee.
    * Features gripping fingers to attach to various golf club grips.
    * Includes a clip for easy attachment to bags or clothing.
    * Made from flexible plastic for durability and ease of use.

* Operation of the Device
    * The golfer attaches the device to the club and places the ball and tee.
    * The tee is inserted into the ground, automatically releasing the ball.
    * The device can retrieve tees from both horizontal and vertical positions.
    * Simplifies the process of teeing up and retrieving without bending over.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application is a continuation of a prior U.S. patent application.
    * Claims priority from a European application filed in 2013.
    * Focuses on a person support apparatus, particularly for hospital beds.
    * Incorporates features for adjusting height and orientation of the patient support frame.
* The apparatus includes a patient support deck and a support assembly.
    * The support assembly has leg assemblies that adjust the height of the deck.
    * Allows caregivers to easily access patients and facilitates patient movement.
    * Supports various positions, including Trendelenburg and reverse Trendelenburg.
* Known arrangements for leg assemblies have several drawbacks.
    * Risks of trapping fingers and frictional resistance during movement.
    * Dust and dirt accumulation can interfere with operation.
    * Previous designs may not provide sufficient stability or robustness.
* The proposed design features an inverted U-shaped channel element.
    * The channel has a continuous upper surface and downward-facing opening.
    * Leg assemblies include guide elements that run along the channel's inner surface.
    * This design enhances stability and reduces the number of parts.
* The channel's downward-facing opening minimizes dirt entry.
    * Any dirt that does enter is less visible during normal use.
    * The design reduces the force needed to lift the patient support frame.
    * Rollers reduce friction compared to sliding elements.
* The mechanism allows for accessories to be fixed to the channel's outer surface.
    * The design minimizes the risk of trapping fingers or body parts.
    * Enhances safety for both patients and caregivers.
    * Features can be applied across various embodiments of the apparatus.
* The detailed description includes various embodiments and their configurations.
    * Illustrative figures depict the apparatus in different positions.
    * Describes the actuator mechanism for raising and lowering the deck.
    * Highlights the importance of stabilizer elements for structural integrity.
* The braking mechanism is integrated into the castors of the apparatus.
    * Brakes engage when the deck is lowered to prevent movement.
    * The design allows for closer positioning of the braking mechanism.
    * Can be actuated by caregivers using their foot.
* Variations and modifications to the described embodiments are possible.
    * The disclosure encourages innovation within the defined claims.
    * Emphasizes the adaptability of the design for different applications.
    * Aims to improve patient care and safety in hospital settings.
* The application incorporates prior art references for context.
    * References include patents and applications related to articulated beds.
    * Acknowledges existing technologies while proposing

<summary>
* The invention is a skin reflectance measuring apparatus.
    * It is useful in pathology and cosmetology.
    * It measures skin reflectance related to sebum secretion and skin diseases.
    * It can evaluate the effectiveness of anti-reflectance products.
    * It aids in grading different skin types.

* Existing methods for measuring surface reflectance are not suitable for skin.
    * Known devices measure only specular reflection.
    * Color influences results, making comparisons difficult.
    * Relative measurements between specular and diffuse reflections are inadequate.
    * Industry devices require flat surfaces and precise positioning.

* The proposed apparatus includes a specialized probe.
    * The probe has a casing with an aperture for skin contact.
    * It uses fiber optics with three optical conductors.
    * The design allows for small measurement areas (10-50 mm²).
    * It accommodates slight deviations in positioning.

* The measuring device processes light signals.
    * It includes light emitting and receiving means.
    * It produces signals for specular and diffuse reflections.
    * Processing means correct for light variations and ambient light.
    * A display device shows the reflectance signal amplitude.

* The apparatus allows for easy handling and operation.
    * The miniaturized probe connects via a flexible fiber optic cable.
    * It does not require high positioning accuracy.
    * Measurements can be taken on uneven skin surfaces.
    * It provides accurate results under less strict conditions.

* Calibration and measurement cycles are controlled digitally.
    * A micro-computer processes the measurements.
    * It uses synchronous detection to account for ambient light.
    * Reflectance is calculated based on differences in reflection intensities.
    * Calibration involves determining constants for accurate measurements.

* The apparatus has been tested on various subjects.
    * Reflectance values were measured on forearms and foreheads.
    * Results showed a correlation between visual appearance and measured reflectance.
    * The mean reflectance for greasy skin was higher than average.
    * Variations in reflectance were noted before and after applying products.

* The design includes specific components for light regulation.
    * A tungsten lamp serves as the light source.
    * Photodiodes measure light intensity for feedback control.
    * A logarithmic amplifier enhances signal processing.
    * The system is designed to mimic human visual perception.

* The display and recording functions enhance usability.
    * Reflectance values are displayed in real-time.
    * The operator can adjust probe positioning based on feedback.
    * Results can be printed or stored for

<summary>
* The invention pertains to dental cleaning and massaging apparatus.
	* * Traditional brushing, toothpicks, and floss are insufficient for preventing dental issues.
	* * Hydro-therapy devices have been developed for better cleaning and gum health.

* The apparatus features a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members.
	* * These members fit snugly over the teeth and gums.
	* * They are connected by membranes and include pneumatic means for gum massage.

* The design includes bite blocks and air-sacks for effective operation.
	* * Bite blocks hold the teeth in place during use.
	* * Air-sacks inflate and deflate to create a massaging action on the gums.

* The control box manages air and fluid delivery for cleaning and massaging.
	* * Users can choose between air, water, or both for operation.
	* * A remote control device allows for convenient operation.

* The apparatus can be modified for additional features.
	* * Options include adding bristles for enhanced cleaning.
	* * A single coupling could simplify connections between the control panel and mouthpiece.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants.
	* Focuses on pelvic organ prolapse (POP) in women.
	* Aims to improve surgical procedures for repositioning prolapsed organs.
	* Introduces a reliable anchoring method for mesh implants.

* A novel needle design is proposed for surgical threading of implant straps.
	* Features a trap mechanism for securely holding the strap.
	* Allows for threading from the accessible side of the tissue.
	* Includes a mechanism for releasing the strap after threading.

* The anterior implant consists of multiple straps for anchoring to pelvic ligaments.
	* Designed for reconstructing the anterior pelvic floor.
	* Can address prolapse of the urinary bladder, colon, and small intestine.
	* Incorporates spaces to reduce the weight of the implant.

* The posterior implant is also designed for pelvic reconstruction.
	* Comprises straps for anchoring to sacrospinous ligaments.
	* Targets prolapse of the colon, small intestine, and uterus.
	* Similar weight-reduction features as the anterior implant.

* Detailed methods for using the needle and installing implants are provided.
	* Steps include trapping, threading, and releasing the strap.
	* Emphasizes minimal surgical access and reduced invasiveness.
	* Ensures secure placement of the implants without additional perforations.

* The document includes illustrations to support the described methods and devices.
	* Figures depict the implants, needle operation, and surgical procedures.
	* Visual aids enhance understanding of the invention's application.
	* Illustrations are not to scale and serve illustrative purposes only.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides methods and apparatus for ventilatory assistance tailored to a subject's respiratory needs.  
    • It is suitable for both spontaneously and non-spontaneously breathing subjects.  
    • The focus is on long-term ventilatory assistance, especially during sleep.  
 
• Subjects with severe respiratory diseases often require mechanical ventilatory support.  
    • This support can be in-hospital or at home, particularly during sleep.  
    • Ventilators deliver air at varying pressures to assist breathing.  
 
• Existing ventilatory devices often fail to match the subject's breathing patterns accurately.  
    • This can lead to discomfort and reduced efficiency of the device.  
    • Changes in breathing mechanics during sleep increase the need for ventilatory support.  
 
• The invention aims to achieve three main goals for ventilatory devices.  
    • Goals include matching assistance to spontaneous efforts, automatic adjustment of support, and functioning with large leaks.  
    • Current devices do not meet all these goals simultaneously.  
 
• Proportional assist ventilation (PAV) adjusts pressure based on the subject's breathing but has limitations.  
    • It can overestimate inspired volume in the presence of leaks.  
    • It relies on chemoreceptor reflexes, which may be inadequate in some patients.  
 
• The invention introduces a fuzzy logic approach to determine the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle.  
    • This method calculates phase based on airflow characteristics.  
    • It allows for continuous adjustment of ventilatory support.  
 
• The apparatus includes transducers for measuring flow and pressure, and a processor for calculations.  
    • It can be used in various modes, including CPAP and proportional assist ventilation.  
    • The design aims to improve comfort and efficiency in ventilatory support.  
 
• The invention addresses issues related to leaks and varying respiratory mechanics.  
    • It dynamically adjusts to sudden changes in leak conditions.  
    • The system can operate effectively across a range of patient needs.  
 
• The methods described involve calculating desired pressure modulation based on the subject's respiratory patterns.  
    • This includes determining the phase of the respiratory cycle and adjusting pressure accordingly.  
    • The approach aims to provide a more responsive and comfortable ventilatory experience.  
 
• The invention is distinct from existing technologies by combining multiple functionalities into a single device.  
    • It allows for tailored support based on individual patient needs.  
    • The use of fuzzy logic enhances the adaptability of the ventilatory assistance provided.

<summary>
• The invention is an electro-surgical dissection and cauterization instrument designed for laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.  
	• It addresses issues with visibility and inadvertent cauterization of healthy tissue during surgery.  
• Current electro-surgical instruments have working tip electrodes that extend directly from the insulating sleeve.  
	• This design obstructs the surgeon's view and can lead to unintentional cauterization of surrounding healthy tissue.  
• The new instrument features a rigid arm that extends between the working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve.  
	• This arm is laterally offset from the sleeve's longitudinal axis, improving visibility of the surgical site.  
• The instrument includes an insulating layer along its length to prevent unintended cauterization.  
	• This ensures that only the working tip electrode makes contact with tissue during procedures.  
• The design allows for various working tip electrode configurations to meet different surgical needs.  
	• Examples include hooks for grasping tissue and spatulas for cauterizing bleeding vessels.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus.  
    • It features a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, and multiple transmit/receive coils.  
• Current MRI systems require adjustments for different exposure positions.  
    • Adjustments can take 10 to 90 seconds, which is often impractical for certain procedures.  
• The invention aims to provide high-contrast exposures quickly, even for larger body segments.  
    • This is achieved by determining adjustment parameters in a prior process before exposures.  
• The adjustment parameters are stored for the duration of the examination.  
    • This allows for quick switching of coils and reduced examination times.  
• The apparatus can utilize different magnet designs, such as cylindrical or horseshoe magnets.  
    • The design accommodates various patient receptacle configurations.  
• The adjustment unit processes inputs from coil configurations and support plate position.  
    • It outputs control signals to various components, ensuring optimized imaging conditions.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to fasteners for albums, such as photographic albums and scrapbooks.
	* * It allows for easy addition or replacement of album pages.
* Conventional screw-type fasteners are difficult to use and align.
	* * They consist of male and female screws that can be cumbersome when adding pages.
* The new fastener design includes strap anchors and a strap for easy page management.
	* * The strap passes through aligned apertures in the covers and pages.
* The strap anchors are designed to securely hold the strap while allowing for easy release.
	* * They feature locking lips and inter-engaging formations to prevent displacement.
* The fastener allows for adjustment of strap length to accommodate varying album thickness.
	* * This provides greater versatility compared to traditional screw fasteners.
* The fasteners can be produced inexpensively, maintaining cost-effectiveness.
	* * This is important for cost-sensitive album markets.
* The design ensures a low profile for the fasteners when the album is closed.
	* * This prevents interference with the closure of the album covers.
* A modified embodiment includes saw-tooth profile ribs for improved grip.
	* * Additional ribs enhance the contact area and prevent slipping of the strap.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a new sulky design.  
    • It features two wheels on the same rotational axis.  
    • The design includes a driver's seat and shafts for a draught animal.  
• Current sulkies face challenges in construction and materials.  
    • Traditional designs are often heavy and require welding.  
    • Aluminium attempts have failed due to poor strength.  
• The new sulky aims for lightweight and durable materials.  
    • It can be assembled from flat elements for easy storage.  
    • Components can be produced inexpensively using casting and extrusion.  
• The design allows for a stable load transfer to the wheels.  
    • Shafts are fastened in the planes of the wheels.  
    • This avoids traditional welding processes.  
• The new construction reduces weight significantly.  
    • The complete sulky weighs approximately 18 kg.  
    • It achieves a weight reduction of about 40%.  
• The sulky can be easily assembled by users.  
    • It requires only ordinary hand tools for assembly.  
    • Connections are secure and accommodate standard manufacturing tolerances.  
• The design supports efficient packaging and transportation.  
    • The sulky can be shipped as a flat package.  
    • It is suitable for do-it-yourself assembly kits.  
• A unique color display system is incorporated.  
    • Color tapes can be applied in the profiles' recesses.  
    • This allows for customization at a low cost.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses ventilation systems for rotating water feeds in water-cooled generators.
	*	Air elimination is crucial to prevent overheating and steam bubble formation.
	*	Air bubbles can block flow paths, reducing cooling system efficiency.
	*	Existing solutions lack effective ventilation for rotating parts.

* The invention proposes a bypass system to remove air or gas bubbles.
	*	The bypass includes at least one inlet and outlet between feed and discharge ducts.
	*	It utilizes pressure gradients for automatic operation.
	*	The design aims for simplicity and efficiency.

* Various embodiments of the bypass are described.
	*	Bypasses can be arranged in end faces or as radial pipes.
	*	Coiled pipe designs are also considered for minimizing leakage.
	*	Multiple bypasses can be implemented based on structural needs.

* The bypass design enhances hydrodynamic resistance.
	*	This allows for adequate pressure drops over short distances.
	*	Low flow resistance is maintained for effective ventilation.
	*	Smaller outer dimensions for the ventilation system are achievable.

* The drawings illustrate different configurations of the ventilation system.
	*	Each figure shows variations in bypass arrangements and designs.
	*	Flow directions and pressure points are indicated in the schematics.
	*	Specific features like spiral grooves are included to optimize flow.

* The invention effectively eliminates air bubbles at the lowest pressure point.
	*	Inlet openings are strategically placed around the axis of rotation.
	*	Bypass flow is directed to enhance ventilation effects.
	*	The design ensures operational efficiency in cooling systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a steering column for motor vehicles that features a jacket unit and a retaining part.
    * The jacket unit supports a steering shaft and is designed to be displaceable under certain force conditions.
    * It includes an energy absorption connection using bending wires or strips that deform during displacement.
    * A break-away connection is also present, which releases when a force limit is exceeded, allowing for energy absorption during a crash.
    * The design aims to reduce the force peak during the break-away process, enhancing safety.

* The steering column is adjustable in length, height, and inclination, providing flexibility for driver comfort.
    * A securement device maintains the position of the jacket unit relative to the bracket unit during normal operation.
    * The retaining part is integrated into the securement device, ensuring stability while allowing for energy absorption in a crash.
    * The connection between the jacket unit and retaining part can be achieved through various methods, including shear bolts and frictional closures.
    * The design allows for adjustments without compromising safety features during a collision.

* The assembly process involves prestressing the bending wire or strip to enhance energy absorption capabilities.
    * The bending wire or strip is elastically deformed during assembly, creating a reset force that aids in energy absorption.
    * The steering column's design can accommodate various configurations, including single or multiple bending wires.
    * The invention also considers noise reduction and vibration dampening through its prestressed components.
    * Alternative configurations for the bracket unit and securement device are possible, allowing for customization based on vehicle design.
</summary>

<summary>
• The application is a continuation-in-part of previous abandoned applications.  
	• • It claims equitable rights from earlier filings.  
	• • Focuses on a method for mounting glass panels in vehicle windows.  
 
• The invention addresses the installation of curved windows using flat glass panels.  
	• • Highlights the prevalence of curved windshields in modern automobiles.  
	• • Notes that rear and side windows are also curved but less noticeably.  

• Current installation processes for curved glass panels are costly and complex.  
	• • Involves expensive annealing and tempering processes.  
	• • Results in glass that is less flexible and more brittle.  

• Untreated flat glass is more flexible and less likely to shatter in accidents.  
	• • Pre-contoured glass can dislodge and shatter during collisions.  
	• • Lack of glass can compromise vehicle structural integrity in accidents.  

• The cost of flat glass is significantly lower than pre-contoured glass.  
	• • Flat glass costs about one-eighth to one-tenth of pre-treated glass.  
	• • This cost difference impacts consumer expenses considerably.  

• The invention aims to provide an economical method for installing curved windows.  
	• • Utilizes flat, uncontoured glass that can be flexed into shape.  
	• • Employs adhesive sealant to secure the glass in place.  

• The method involves flexing the glass and applying adhesive in situ.  
	• • The flexing creates an urgency for the glass to return to its flat shape.  
	• • This allows for effective application of adhesive sealant.  

• The fastening means includes resilient clips and reveal molding.  
	• • Clips maintain the glass in place while the adhesive cures.  
	• • Reveal molding applies pressure to ensure the glass conforms to the window bay.  

• The adhesive used is preferably a polysulfide material.  
	• • It exhibits rubber-like properties when cured, allowing for flexibility.  
	• • This adhesive is resistant to cracking and corrosion in various conditions.  

• The invention is adaptable and can be modified by those skilled in the art.  
	• • The disclosure is intended to be illustrative rather than limiting.  
	• • Various changes and modifications are anticipated within the scope of the invention.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method and apparatus for efficiently removing oxygen from water, particularly for use on offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms.
	* The apparatus features a vessel with multiple gasification chambers that allow for the introduction of a second gas to displace the first gas (oxygen) from the liquid.
	* It aims to minimize equipment corrosion and reduce the physical profile compared to traditional oxygen removal methods like stripping towers.

* The system operates continuously, utilizing mechanisms to create turbulence and facilitate gas exchange, ultimately achieving low oxygen levels in the treated water.
	* The design allows for control over gas ingestion and liquid flow, with potential for additional chemical scavenging if necessary.
	* The expected reduction in oxygen concentration can range from 6-10 ppm to about 0.5-1.0 ppm in seawater.
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims priority from a European patent application.
	• The focus is on a packaging machine with synchronized work stations.
  
• The packaging machine may be a deep-drawing type.
	• It processes packaging material through various work stations for different operations.

• Conventional machines require separate drives for each work station.
	• This complicates synchronization of tool movements.

• The proposed machine features a central shaft driving multiple tool members.
	• This design allows for mechanical synchronization of movements.

• Transfer mechanisms convert the shaft's rotation into tool movements.
	• These mechanisms can include toggle levers or cam systems.

• The machine can have work stations at different vertical levels.
	• This arrangement enhances compactness and efficiency.

• The design includes a frame to stabilize the shaft and reduce vibrations.
	• Stability is crucial for maintaining precision during packaging.

• Tool members can be adjusted without affecting the shaft or transfer mechanism.
	• This flexibility accommodates different packaging materials and shapes.
</summary>

<summary>
• This application is a continuation-in-part of previous U.S. patent applications related to disposable depressed center grinding wheels.
	• The invention focuses on a mounting hub that allows quick attachment and release to power tools.

• The invention addresses issues with securing finishing articles to power tools.
	• Traditional methods often required tools for removal, complicating the process.

• Previous designs used adhesives to attach mounting hubs to grinding wheels.
	• Adhesives sometimes failed, leading to rotational movement between the wheel and hub.

• The invention proposes a drive member assembly that does not use adhesives.
	• It features a backing flange and a retaining nut that secure the assembly without additional tools.

• The assembly allows for easy attachment and removal of the grinding wheel.
	• The design ensures that the wheel is placed in compression during use, preventing slippage.

• The pressure cap plays a crucial role in maintaining the assembly's integrity.
	• It engages with the backing flange to apply compressive forces during operation.

• The assembly is designed to be lightweight and cost-effective compared to prior art.
	• It eliminates the need for bulky die-cast components and reduces manufacturing labor.

• The invention accommodates various standard sizes of grinding wheels.
	• It improves usability for different applications while maintaining safety standards.

• The assembly is engineered for smooth operation with minimal vibration.
	• Proper alignment of components ensures stability during use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a hydraulic unit for vehicle brake systems designed to prevent pressure fluid from reaching electrical components.
	* The unit features a housing block with a pump and an eccentric chamber that directs entrained pressure fluid to spring chambers, away from sensitive parts.
	* This design allows for a hermetic seal, enabling the unit to be submerged without damage and reducing the need for additional pressure equalization elements.

* The hydraulic unit includes multiple conduit portions that facilitate both the diversion of pressure fluid and pressure equalization between the motor and the spring chambers.
	* The conduits are designed to minimize production costs by utilizing fewer components and simplifying the assembly process.
	* The design also allows for flexibility in the size of the pressure fluid containers based on the intended use of the hydraulic unit.

* Three exemplary embodiments of the hydraulic unit demonstrate variations in the design while maintaining the core functionality.
	* Each embodiment incorporates features that enhance sealing against environmental factors and improve the overall reliability of the unit.
	* The third embodiment simplifies production by eliminating certain openings while still achieving necessary pressure equalization.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to power and free conveyor systems designed for efficient carrier transfer between predetermined paths.
	* A third dog mechanism allows for selective transfer across varying distances, enhancing system flexibility.
* The system utilizes pivoted pusher dogs that engage with conveyor pushers to facilitate movement without changing track elevation.
	* Cam projections on the dogs ensure they can be held inoperative until needed for transfer, minimizing delays.
* Various configurations are described for transferring carriers, including systems with short and long gaps between conveyors.
	* The design allows for simultaneous or sequential operation of the dogs to optimize transfer efficiency and reduce costs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention claims priority from a provisional application and focuses on a new type of grounding liner for railroad car center plate assemblies.  
    • The liner is designed to eliminate the need for additional grounding apparatus.  
    • It utilizes ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) mixed with conductive materials like carbon black.  
    • The invention aims to improve electrical conductivity while maintaining self-lubricating properties.  

• The new liner addresses issues with traditional manganese steel liners, which require frequent lubrication.  
    • Traditional liners can lead to wear and potential derailment if not properly maintained.  
    • The UHMW-PE liner provides a self-lubricating solution that reduces maintenance costs.  
    • The design allows for effective grounding without the drawbacks of metal-to-metal contact.  

• The liner's configuration ensures it fits securely between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate.  
    • It is designed to minimize movement and wear between components.  
    • The liner maintains its shape under compressive forces, enhancing durability.  
    • It also features slip surfaces to facilitate the necessary swiveling action of the car trucks.  

• The invention exceeds existing electrical conductivity standards for railroad cars.  
    • It aims for a resistance of no more than 1×10^6 ohms, significantly better than previous solutions.  
    • The conductive properties are enhanced under load, improving performance when the car is fully loaded.  
    • The design prevents the accumulation of foreign materials that could interfere with lubrication.  

• Alternative embodiments of the liner are proposed, including flat horizontal disk configurations.  
    • These variations can be adapted to different truck bolster designs.  
    • The flat disk can also incorporate conductive materials in a concentrated manner for improved performance.  
    • Each design maintains the self-lubricating and conductive properties essential for effective operation.  

• The invention is expected to provide significant improvements over previous liner technologies.  
    • It combines the benefits of self-lubrication with enhanced electrical conductivity.  
    • The design reduces the need for costly inspections and maintenance associated with grounding clips.  
    • Overall, it aims to enhance the safety and efficiency of railroad car operations.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a valve for dispensing viscous substances.
	• Designed for one-handed operation, ideal for fast-food settings.
  
• Prior art includes two main valve types: rotatable cylindrical and ball-type.
	• Both types are difficult to clean and allow residue accumulation.

• The new valve is a gate valve mounted on a bag or pouch spout.
	• It features a tubular sleeve and a reciprocable gate for dispensing.

• The gate valve includes a guide that allows for smooth movement.
	• The design ensures a seal when closed and unobstructed flow when open.

• The valve assembly is removable for easy cleaning and reassembly.
	• It utilizes resilient lugs to allow disassembly without damage.

• The valve is designed to fit snugly into the spout of a flexible bag.
	• Sealing ribs on the sleeve ensure a tight frictional fit.

• The valve can be operated with one hand while holding a receiving vessel.
	• Users can easily engage and disengage the gate using their fingers.

• The valve functions effectively even when the bag is inclined.
	• It ensures complete cut-off and effective sealing when closed.

• The design allows for gradual or quick movement between open and closed positions.
	• The passage remains completely unobstructed when the valve is open.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a vehicular rearview mirror system that adapts to different vehicle control output protocols.  
    • The system includes an electro-optic reflective element that adjusts its reflectance based on a drive signal.  
    • A mirror control monitors the vehicle control output to determine the protocol, allowing compatibility with various vehicles.  
    • The system can respond to different types of vehicle information, such as gear status or door status.  
• The mirror control may utilize a microcomputer to process the output and maintain parameters for determining the reverse-gear indication protocol.  
    • The power-up sequence establishes initial protocol assumptions based on the vehicle's state.  
    • The main sequence continuously adjusts the protocol based on vehicle operation, ensuring accurate reflectance control.  
    • The system can utilize light sensors to further refine the control of the reflective element.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles that incorporates an anti-dive device.
	* The system aims to reduce vertical vibrations and improve braking efficiency by controlling the front fork's contraction during braking.
	* It utilizes hydraulic pressure from the braking system to operate the anti-dive device, which dampens the front fork's movement.
	* The design includes a hydraulic pump, modulator, and pressure discharge valve to manage braking force and prevent wheel lock.

* The system features two embodiments with different anti-dive mechanisms.
	* The first embodiment uses a hydraulic relay chamber and a valve body that responds to braking pressure to limit fork contraction.
	* The second embodiment employs a braking torque-responsive unit that adjusts the oil passage based on the brake caliper's movement.
	* Both designs aim to enhance the motorcycle's stability and braking performance by quickly increasing the load on the front wheel.
</summary>

<summary>
* This application is a continuation of a provisional patent application.
    * Filed on July 20, 2000.
    * Complete disclosure is incorporated by reference.
    * Relates to movable partitions and panels.
* The invention addresses cargo separation during transportation.
    * Focuses on multi-temperature transport.
    * Aims to insulate cargo effectively.
    * Relevant for refrigerated trailers, railcars, and containers.
* Current refrigerated transport systems have limitations.
    * Typically maintain a single temperature throughout.
    * Inefficient when cargo does not fill the entire space.
    * Causes increased fuel consumption and wear on refrigeration units.
* Movable partitions and bulkheads are known solutions.
    * Allow division of cargo areas for different temperatures.
    * Configurations vary by transport type (trailer, railcar, container).
    * Panels can be modular and removable.
* The invention proposes an improved partition system.
    * Features independently movable panels.
    * Panels can slide along ceiling-mounted rails.
    * Allows for flexible cargo area configurations.
* The design includes various panel and rail configurations.
    * Panels can be raised and stowed when not in use.
    * Trolley assemblies enable movement in multiple directions.
    * Rails can be installed on side walls for different access.
* The rail system is adaptable for various modifications.
    * End rails can be replaced or omitted.
    * Additional rails can accommodate more panels.
    * Different mounting mechanisms can be utilized.
* The panels can be secured in various ways.
    * Options include straps, buckles, and locking pins.
    * Allows for easy separation and reconfiguration.
    * Enhances usability in tight cargo spaces.
* The invention emphasizes efficiency and reduced strain.
    * Minimizes air volume needing temperature control.
    * Facilitates quick adjustments to cargo configurations.
    * Supports independent operation of each panel.
* Various embodiments and modifications are possible.
    * The invention is not limited to described configurations.
    * Encourages innovation within the scope of the claims.
    * Aims to improve cargo transport efficiency and flexibility.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a novel sanitizable rotary valve for liquid chromatography.
    • It aims to separate and purify biological macromolecules in pharmaceutical applications.
    • The valve allows for in-place sanitization without disassembly.
    • A unique diaphragm-like elastomeric seal retains sanitizing fluids during cleaning.
    • The design addresses the need for aseptic operation in fluid handling systems.

• Prior art rotary valves lack sanitizable features and require disassembly for cleaning.
    • Existing designs do not provide means for effective sanitization of contact surfaces.
    • Non-rotary sanitizable valves are known, but rotary options are limited.
    • The invention overcomes these limitations by enabling intermittent flushing.
    • It ensures sterile conditions are maintained during the cleaning process.

• The valve features a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm with multiple sealing ports.
    • The diaphragm is integrally molded to form a flexible wiping lip seal.
    • It allows for cross-flushing of sealing faces while maintaining a fluid-tight seal.
    • The design minimizes the required sealing force to prolong diaphragm life.
    • It incorporates gutters to capture and sweep away any escaping process fluid.

• The invention includes a method for insert molding the rotary valve diaphragm seal.
    • The process involves affixing a mold base to create the desired diaphragm shape.
    • Injection molding is used to form the elastomeric diaphragm in place.
    • The resulting diaphragm has features that enhance its sealing capabilities.
    • This method simplifies manufacturing while ensuring high-quality seals.

• The valve is applicable in simulated moving bed (SMB) liquid chromatography systems.
    • It facilitates efficient separation processes by simulating counter-current flow.
    • The design allows for the connection of multiple columns in a carousel arrangement.
    • It enhances the economic viability of chromatography by maximizing resin usage.
    • The invention supports various separation techniques, including ion exchange and size exclusion.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to improved gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies.
    * Focuses on enhancing efficiency through directional thrust valves and tray construction.
    * Addresses issues of vapor-liquid contact and flow patterns in distillation columns.
    * Aims to reduce pressure drop and liquid hold-up while maintaining operational stability.

* The design includes various configurations of trays, such as cross-flow and counter-flow.
    * Trays consist of solid decks with apertures for vapor ascent and liquid flow.
    * Introduces concepts like Multipass Trays and Multiple Downcomer (MD) trays for better liquid distribution.
    * Highlights the importance of active areas for effective vapor-liquid interaction.

* The valve assembly features a circular design with support legs to direct liquid flow.
    * The first leg is wider to divert liquid around the valve, enhancing vapor flow.
    * Valves are designed to minimize backflow and improve mass transfer efficiency.
    * Incorporates biasing mechanisms to facilitate initial vapor flow through the valve.

* The invention also discusses methods for optimizing liquid and vapor mixing in process columns.
    * Emphasizes the role of directional thrust valves in enhancing flow dynamics.
    * Suggests configurations that prevent liquid from bypassing active tray areas.
    * Aims to improve overall column performance and separation efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
	* The invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly.
	* It aims to generate energy from fluid pressure regulation.
	* Prior art regulators suffer from energy loss and high costs.

* Summary of the Invention
	* The assembly generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
	* It reduces output pressure variances from large input pressure differences.
	* The design is lightweight, portable, and cost-effective.

* Detailed Description of the Preferred Embodiment
	* The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source and a vane motor.
	* The fluid regulator manages pressure before reaching the burner.
	* A generator converts mechanical power into electrical energy.

* Alternative Embodiments
	* A second vane motor can be used for mechanical work.
	* The assembly can be adapted for vehicles using pressurized fluids.
	* Scuba diving applications can utilize the assembly for breathing apparatuses.

* Advantages of the Invention
	* The vane motor extracts work from pressurized fluid.
	* It allows for the use of smaller, less expensive regulators.
	* The assembly enhances efficiency in fluid pressure management.

* Potential Modifications
	* Various motor types, including turbines or piston motors, can be used.
	* Different generator types, including AC and DC, are applicable.
	* The design can accommodate various pressures and dimensions.

* Conclusion
	* The invention provides a versatile solution for fluid pressure regulation.
	* It addresses limitations of prior art while enhancing energy efficiency.
	* Future modifications can expand its applications across industries.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a pallet system designed for efficient loading and unloading of items while minimizing shifting.
	* The system includes a pallet with raised guide rails that accommodate trays with side supports.
	* End stops and end plates are incorporated to restrict movement and enhance stability during transport.

* The pallet system allows for automated loading and unloading of trays.
	* Trays can be slid onto the pallet along the guide rails, with end stops limiting their movement.
	* The design facilitates stacking and interlocking of trays for secure shipping.

* The pallet cap is customizable to fit various pallet sizes and shapes.
	* It features pockets that align with conventional pallet designs for stability and support.
	* The guide rails are designed to complement the specific shapes of the trays being used.

* The materials and manufacturing methods for the pallet system components are versatile.
	* Components can be made from plastics like polypropylene or ABS, using techniques such as thermoforming and injection molding.
	* The design allows for nesting of both pallet caps and end plates for efficient storage when not in use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electrically driven flying saucer utilizing magnetic suspension technology.
	* It aims to optimize internal space and enhance efficiency, safety, and control of the rotary-wing system.

* The rotary-wing system consists of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, and a magnetic suspension shaft.
	* This design minimizes contact and friction, reducing noise and vibration during operation.

* Two improvement solutions are proposed: coaxial axial dual and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension systems.
	* These configurations help counteract reactive torque and improve stability and power performance.

* The electric engine is based on a permanent magnet synchronous motor structure.
	* It features a simple design with high efficiency and easy control, enhancing the overall functionality of the flying saucer.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to streptavidin muteins with enhanced binding affinity for peptide ligands.
	• The muteins contain mutations in the amino acid positions 44 to 53 of streptavidin.
	• These modifications allow for improved isolation, purification, and detection of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins.

• The production process involves recombinant DNA technology to create and express the streptavidin muteins.
	• Host cells, typically E. coli, are transformed with vectors containing the mutein coding sequences.
	• The expressed proteins can be isolated and purified using affinity chromatography techniques.

• Applications of the streptavidin muteins include their use in various detection methods and as components in reagent kits.
	• They can be utilized in ELISA, Western blotting, and other assays requiring high binding strength.
	• The muteins can also facilitate the immobilization of proteins fused with specific peptide sequences for further analysis.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention involves methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.  
    • The nickel catalyst is preferably in the zero oxidation state (Ni(0)).  
    • Suitable nickel catalysts include nickel-boride and nickel-phosphide alloys.  
    • The methods aim for high yields and minimal reagent use.  
    • The reactions can be conducted under mild conditions to avoid decomposition.  

• Guanidines are important in various biologically active compounds and drugs.  
    • They are fully protonated under physiological conditions, enhancing interactions.  
    • Examples of drugs containing guanidine include anti-ulcer and cardiovascular medications.  
    • Efficient synthesis methods are crucial for pharmaceutical development.  
    • The invention addresses the need for safer and more efficient guanylation processes.  

• Traditional methods for synthesizing guanidines often require excess reagents.  
    • Commonly used guanylating agents include thioureas and isothioureas.  
    • Previous methods often involve toxic reagents like mercuric salts.  
    • The invention seeks to reduce the use of toxic compounds in drug synthesis.  
    • It also aims to improve the separation of products from byproducts.  

• The methods allow for the use of various amines and pyrrolidines.  
    • Preferred amines include primary and secondary amines.  
    • The reactions can yield high percentages of guanidines in short times.  
    • The preferred reaction temperature ranges from -30 to 140°C.  
    • Solvent systems like DMF, THF, and DMSO are suitable for the reactions.  

• The invention includes examples demonstrating the effectiveness of the methods.  
    • Various nickel catalysts were tested, showing high yields and efficiency.  
    • The use of different protecting groups in thioureas is highlighted.  
    • The results indicate that nickel catalysts can be reused effectively.  
    • The methods provide a significant advancement in guanidine synthesis.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a method and apparatus for electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
	* * It involves anodic oxidation followed by electrolytic coloration to enhance weatherability.
* Conventional methods for coloring aluminum have limitations in durability and energy consumption.
	* * Existing techniques often result in poor weather resistance and fading over time.
* The invention offers a continuous process for anodizing and coloring aluminum without high energy requirements.
	* * It eliminates the need for direct power connections to the aluminum strip or wire.
* The anodic oxidation bath typically contains 10 to 55% sulfuric acid and may include other salts or acids.
	* * The desired thickness of the oxide film is between 4 to 15 microns for effective coloring.
* The electrolytic coloring bath can include various metal salts to achieve different colors.
	* * Examples include nickel sulfate for yellow-brown to black-brown shades.
* The apparatus includes multiple baths for degreasing, etching, anodizing, coloring, and sealing.
	* * The aluminum strip is continuously processed through these baths for efficiency.
* Electric current control is crucial for both anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring.
	* * Rheostats are used to adjust current levels in different stages of the process.
* The invention allows for the production of aluminum strips with stable and consistent colors.
	* * The process can be adjusted for various colors and thicknesses based on specific needs.
* The sealing treatment can involve boiling water or inorganic salt solutions for durability.
	* * Alternative methods like lacquer coating can also be employed for sealing.
* The apparatus is designed for continuous operation, enhancing industrial applicability and cost-effectiveness.
	* * It aims to produce aluminum products with superior weatherability and fade resistance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome.
    * It involves screening nucleotide sequences for desired phenotypes in plants.
    * The process allows for the integration of DNA sequences of interest into plant chromosomes.
    * It utilizes vectors that enable site-specific recombination for efficient transformation.
* Current methods of plant transformation are often time-consuming and limited in flexibility.
    * Traditional methods include Agrobacterium-mediated delivery and direct transformation techniques.
    * These methods face challenges such as low efficiency and complex integration patterns.
    * The invention aims to overcome these limitations by enabling in planta engineering of DNA sequences.
    * It allows for the assembly of complex DNA sequences from simpler precursors.
* The process enables the production of genetically stable transgenic plants or plant cells.
    * It allows for the screening of DNA libraries for desired traits.
    * The method can be applied to various plant species, including agronomically important crops.
    * It facilitates the rapid optimization of sequences for gene expression.
    * The invention also addresses biosafety concerns by ensuring that all integrated sequences are of plant origin.
* The invention has significant applications in functional genomics and directed evolution.
    * It allows for the assembly of different DNA sequences of interest for diverse traits.
    * The process can be used for gene function analysis and the development of new plant varieties.
    * It provides a modular approach to vector design, reducing cloning work.
    * The method enhances the efficiency of producing transgenic plants with desired characteristics.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention pertains to swash plate compressors for refrigerant gas.
    * It focuses on reducing frictional wear through a fluorocarbon coating.
    * The coating allows the use of lower-cost alloy materials.
    * Improved durability and efficiency are key benefits.

* Description of the Related Art
    * Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning.
    * High friction occurs due to shear-type contact between the swash plate and piston shoes.
    * Existing coatings, like those from U.S. Pat. No. 5,056,417, have limitations under high friction loads.
    * There is a need for a durable, friction-reducing coating that doesn't require electroplating.

* Summary of the Invention
    * The invention features a swash plate with a heat curable, cross-linked coating.
    * The coating includes a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious, and load-bearing additives.
    * It allows the use of low silicon aluminum without metal plating.
    * The coating is applied via aqueous spray and cured at elevated temperatures.

* Detailed Description of the Preferred Embodiments
    * The compressor consists of a cylinder block and reciprocating pistons.
    * The swash plate is mounted on a rotary shaft and interacts with piston shoes.
    * The coating enhances durability and reduces friction, improving efficiency.
    * Non-hypereutectic aluminum can perform equally to hypereutectic aluminum with the coating.

* Experimental Results
    * Coated swash plates show significantly higher seizure loads compared to uncoated ones.
    * The polyfluoro elastomer coating provides better performance than traditional coatings.
    * Curing time and temperature affect the durability of the coating.
    * The coating maintains a low friction coefficient during testing.

* Coating Application Process
    * The coating is applied using liquid spray methods.
    * A roughened surface on the swash plate enhances mechanical adhesion.
    * The coating process eliminates the need for high surface finishing.
    * Preferred surface roughness is achieved through various machining techniques.

* Performance Comparisons
    * Coated swash plates outperform uncoated and tin-coated counterparts.
    * The fluorocarbon coating provides a low friction coefficient throughout testing.
    * Non-hypereutectic aluminum swash plates perform comparably to hypereutectic ones.
    * The coating's thickness is optimized for durability and performance.

* Conclusion
    * The

<summary>
* The invention introduces novel organic polymers for anti-reflective coatings in semiconductor photolithography.
    * These polymers are designed to absorb light at 193 nm and 248 nm wavelengths.
    * They help eliminate standing wave effects and light reflection during the manufacturing of DRAM devices.
    * The polymers can be synthesized from various resins and diazonaphthoquinone halides.
    * The resulting anti-reflective coatings are spectroscopically stable and improve yield in semiconductor pattern formation.

* The preparation methods and compositions for these anti-reflective coatings are detailed.
    * The coatings can be formed by mixing the polymers with light-absorbing compounds.
    * The process involves dissolving the polymer in organic solvents and applying it to silicon wafers.
    * Hard-baking the coated wafers creates a cross-linked structure, enhancing stability.
    * The invention demonstrates superior performance with various light sources, including E-beam and EUV.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention presents a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable film made from crystallizable thermoplastics, with a thickness ranging from 10 to 350 μm.  
    • The film incorporates at least one white pigment, a flame retardant, and a UV absorber, ensuring good mechanical and optical properties while being cost-effective to produce.  
• The film is suitable for outdoor applications, maintaining its properties without yellowing or embrittlement over time, and can be produced using masterbatch technology.  
    • It meets fire safety standards (DIN 4102 and UL 94) and exhibits excellent thermoformability, allowing for complex moldings without the need for predrying.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention presents a method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a)  
    • The process involves continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b)  
    • Utilizes heterogeneous catalysis for high efficiency  
    • Aims for high conversion and selectivity rates exceeding 99%  
 
• Background highlights the need for improved production methods  
    • Existing methods yield undesirable co-products and have low selectivity  
    • Previous patents describe various catalysts and processes with limitations  
    • The invention addresses these issues with a novel approach  
 
• The process operates under specific conditions for optimal results  
    • Requires a molar ratio of HF to 142b greater than 1:1  
    • Preferred ratios are between 2.5:1 and 10:1  
    • Reaction temperatures can range from 100° C. to 325° C.  
 
• Catalysts used include chromium salts, with or without co-catalysts  
    • CrF3·4H2O and Cr/Ni/AlF3 are highlighted as effective catalysts  
    • Catalyst performance remains high even under challenging conditions  
    • Regeneration of spent catalysts is feasible and effective  
 
• The reactor design is crucial for the process efficiency  
    • A plug flow reactor is preferred for high conversion rates  
    • The reactor can be operated under adiabatic conditions  
    • Various methods for product purification and byproduct removal are discussed  
 
• The invention demonstrates significant improvements over prior art  
    • Achieves high selectivity for 143a while minimizing byproducts  
    • Addresses regulatory concerns regarding the use of certain compounds  
    • Provides a practical solution for industrial applications  
 
• Experimental examples validate the effectiveness of the process  
    • Multiple examples showcase conversion rates and selectivity  
    • Results indicate the robustness of the catalysts under various conditions  
    • The process is adaptable for different feed compositions and conditions  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention presents an improved process for deacylation and desulfurization of pyrazolotriazoles.  
		• The process utilizes hypophosphorous acid to enhance product yield.  
		• It reduces the formation of unwanted sulfur-containing impurities.  
• Pyrazolotriazoles are valuable magenta couplers in photography but are challenging to synthesize.  
		• Current methods yield significant impurities, complicating further reactions.  
		• The new process aims to streamline synthesis and improve purity.  
• The improved method involves a two-step reaction process.  
		• The first step is a ring contraction using acetic anhydride.  
		• The second step combines hydrolysis and desulfurization with hydrochloric acid.  
• Hypophosphorous acid significantly lowers the production of elemental sulfur and organic impurities.  
		• It allows for higher yields of the desired product (up to 82% yield).  
		• The purity of the product can reach 98% as determined by HPLC.  
• The process is straightforward and economically viable for industrial adaptation.  
		• It minimizes detrimental impurities that can interfere with subsequent reactions.  
		• The gaseous by-product H2S is easier to manage than solid sulfur.  
• The invention includes specific examples demonstrating the effectiveness of the process.  
		• Example 1 illustrates the synthesis of a specific pyrazolotriazole with high yield and purity.  
		• Additional examples provide variations and confirm the robustness of the method.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
    * A method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types.
    * Sequentially takes small partial quantities from fiber bales.
    * Aims to eliminate residual fibers and achieve a homogeneous mixture.
    * Addresses disadvantages of existing methods that leave residual fibers.

* Measurement and Removal Process
    * Each fiber bale's entire quantity is measured before fiber removal.
    * A predetermined partial quantity is calculated based on the measurement.
    * Only the calculated quantity is removed from each fiber bale in sequence.
    * Ensures all fiber bales are opened without leaving residuals.

* Control Mechanism
    * The apparatus includes a control device that manages the fiber removal process.
    * A timing relay ensures that fiber quantities are removed within a set period.
    * The control system coordinates the output rate with processing machines.
    * A computer processes signals from measuring devices to optimize operations.

* Apparatus Design
    * Features a bale opener and a quantity measuring device.
    * The measuring device can be a height-measuring arrangement.
    * The control apparatus includes a programmable control for operation management.
    * The design allows for adjustments based on the fiber bale's characteristics.

* Preferred Embodiments
    * Two embodiments are described: one with a carriage and another with a vertical stand.
    * Both designs utilize height-measuring devices for accurate fiber quantity determination.
    * The control system is adaptable to different operational setups.
    * Each embodiment aims to ensure efficient and precise fiber removal.

* Examples of Operation
    * Three examples illustrate the method's application with varying parameters.
    * Example 1 focuses on consistent removal across multiple passes.
    * Example 2 introduces time constraints for fiber removal.
    * Example 3 allows for different removal periods for each fiber bale.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics.  
    • The yarns in at least two layers are laid at angles between 30° and 150° to the fabric's long axis.  
    • Fabrics are held together by stitching, adhesive bonding, or other external means.  
• Traditional fabric manufacturing techniques like knitting and weaving are insufficient for modern structural applications.  
    • Non-woven fabrics are preferred for uses requiring high strength and uniformity.  
    • These fabrics consist of multiple layers held together before resin impregnation.  
• The invention improves upon existing methods by allowing for parallel courses of yarns.  
    • A rake mechanism is synchronized with yarn carriers to enhance parallelism.  
    • Overlapping of yarn courses can be controlled to adjust fabric density.  
• The apparatus includes independent conveyors and yarn carriers that can operate at different speeds.  
    • The yarn carriers can drop below the level of needles to facilitate yarn placement.  
    • The system allows for flexibility in the number of yarn layers and angles used.  
• The bonding mechanism can utilize various methods, including stitching and adhesive application.  
    • The final strength of the fabric is achieved through resin impregnation.  
    • The invention allows for efficient production of fabrics used in structural components.  
• Variations in the design and operation of the apparatus are possible within the invention's scope.  
    • The loops formed during yarn placement can be cut away after bonding.  
    • The invention is not limited to the described embodiments and can be adapted as needed.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on a method and apparatus for weft insertion in multiple-color air jet looms.  
	• It aims to adjust the weft carrying force based on the thickness of the selected weft thread to optimize air consumption.  
• Traditional air jet looms use uniform air pressure for all weft threads, leading to inefficiencies.  
	• The invention proposes varying air pressure and timing for different weft threads to maintain consistent insertion speeds.  
• Various embodiments illustrate different pneumatic piping systems and control mechanisms for achieving the desired weft carrying forces.  
	• These systems include adjustable subnozzles, regulators, and valves to cater to different weft types.  
• The invention allows for stable weft insertion and reduced air consumption, enhancing the efficiency of weaving operations.  
	• It is applicable to looms using multiple weft threads, not just two, and can be modified for various configurations.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on a process for spinning bast fibres into yarn, aiming to reduce end breakage rates.
	* The process involves health preserving bast fibres, carding, and spinning under controlled temperature and humidity conditions.
* The yarn produced can be made from various bast fibres, including jute, kenaf, and hemp, with specific weight percentages.
	* The process allows for blended spinning with other fibres, enhancing flexibility and spinnability.
* Experimental results demonstrate significant reductions in end breakage rates for yarns produced using the described methods.
