	* Various experiments show end breakage rates reduced to between 150-200 times per hour for yarns of 12 s fineness.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on improving nip presses used in various industries, particularly in papermaking, by addressing the issue of rotational variability in nip pressure profiles.
    • The invention utilizes multiple sensors strategically placed on a sensing roll to measure pressure at various cross-directional positions.
    • These sensors work together to average pressure readings, compensating for rotational variability and providing a more accurate nip pressure profile.
    • The system allows for real-time monitoring and adjustments to ensure uniform pressure distribution across the nip region.

• The technology enhances the quality of the final product by ensuring consistent pressure application during the manufacturing process.
    • It reduces the risk of defects in the paper, such as poor quality or structural issues, caused by uneven pressure.
    • The invention can be integrated with existing machinery for improved efficiency and reduced downtime.
    • It also provides valuable data on roll wear and operational stability, aiding in maintenance and operational decisions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder designed for use with ironing boards.
	* It supports the electrical cord of an iron above the ironing surface and holds items like spray starch or beverages.
	* The apparatus features a removable clamp, flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder for convenience and storage.

* The design includes a "C" shaped clamp, a flexible mast for the cord, and an electrical outlet for the iron's plug.
	* The article holder is secured with tangs and can accommodate various items while preventing interference with the outlet.
	* The apparatus can be easily disassembled for storage, allowing the ironing board to be stored without removal of the device.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention pertains to buttonhole controlling devices for sewing machines.
    * Existing devices may not work effectively with all fabric types.
    * Variations in material can lead to improper buttonhole stitching.
    * The invention aims to ensure buttonhole stitching closes without overlap.

* Summary of the Invention
    * The device includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly.
    * The assembly moves with the fabric and adjusts based on button size.
    * An adjustable stop allows precise control over buttonhole closure.
    * This prevents open buttonholes or overlapping stitches.

* Description of the Drawings
    * Several figures illustrate the sewing machine and buttonhole device.
    * The drawings show various stages of buttonhole formation.
    * They depict the relationship between the device components.
    * The figures help visualize the operation of the invention.

* Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    * The sewing machine features a needle bar and presser bar.
    * The buttonhole device is similar to a previously patented design.
    * It controls a tripping lever that manages the sewing process.
    * The device includes flexible contacts to facilitate buttonhole sewing.

* Device Components
    * The buttonhole device consists of a foot pad and a travelling assembly.
    * The assembly includes a work engaging shoe and a plate.
    * Springs define the initial position of the travelling assembly.
    * The device features notches for centering buttons during use.

* Operation of the Device
    * The button is placed between notches to set buttonhole length.
    * The operator adjusts the screw to control the tripping lever.
    * The machine sews top bar and zig-zag stitches in sequence.
    * Adjustments can be made based on the quality of the buttonhole.

* Adjustments for Different Materials
    * Operators can fine-tune the device for various fabric types.
    * Adjustments are made using a sample piece of the new material.
    * The goal is to compensate for material slippage during sewing.
    * Proper adjustments ensure consistent buttonhole quality across fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs.
	* * It involves applying a liquid treatment solution to a moving textile web.
	* * The apparatus includes a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch.
	* * The design aims to improve washing or rinsing without stacking the textile web.

* Previous methods had limitations, such as requiring minimum textile strength.
	* * Techniques like spraying and suction were not effective for sensitive materials.
	* * Stacked configurations could damage knitted fabrics or smudge printed materials.
	* * The invention addresses these issues by allowing a spread-out, single-layer web.

* The apparatus enhances the action time of the applied liquid on the textile.
	* * Longer contact time improves the washing effect, especially for printing thickeners.
	* * The spread-out condition reduces tension in the textile web.
	* * Effective washing is achieved without soiling the fabric's background.

* The design allows for compact construction and efficient operation.
	* * The suction device helps the web adhere to the conveyor belt.
	* * The apparatus can handle various fabric types, including less resistant materials.
	* * It can be used for soilage washing and subsequent fastness treatments.

* Two embodiments of the apparatus are described.
	* * The first uses an air pass with multiple rollers for dwell stretches.
	* * The second employs a sieve drum for guiding the textile web.
	* * Both designs ensure minimal tension in the textile during processing.

* The apparatus includes features for recycling liquid used in treatment.
	* * Catch plates collect and return liquid for reuse.
	* * This enhances efficiency and reduces waste in the treatment process.
	* * The design supports continuous operation with minimal downtime.

* The invention is adaptable for various applications and modifications.
	* * It can be tailored to specific fabric types and treatment needs.
	* * The principles can inspire further innovations in textile processing.
	* * The focus remains on improving efficiency and fabric care.

* The detailed description includes schematic illustrations of the apparatus.
	* * Figures show the arrangement of components and flow of the textile web.
	* * The illustrations help clarify the operational principles of the invention.
	* * They serve as a guide for understanding the apparatus's functionality.
</summary>

<summary>
• Division of application 
    • This is a division of application Ser. No. 445,501.  
    • Related to co-pending cases Application Ser. Nos. 445,028, 445,503, and 445,504.  
    • Common assignee with the present application.  
    • Filed on Feb. 25, 1974, now U.S. Pat. No. 3,937,043.  

• Background of the invention 
    • Relates to an air flow system for dry cleaners.  
    • Induces ambient air flow when the machine door is opened.  
    • Aims to minimize escape of toxic solvent vapors.  
    • Previous systems exhausted residual vapors, which is not ideal for expensive solvents.  

• Summary of the invention 
    • Provides a separate air flow system for ambient air intake.  
    • Includes an intake fan and duct to minimize solvent vapor loss.  
    • A normally closed valve isolates the intake system during operation.  
    • Air is drawn in only when the access door is opened.  

• Description of the drawings 
    • Includes schematic drawings of the dry cleaner's systems.  
    • Shows the solvent distributing system and air distributing system.  
    • Timer cycle chart indicates components during the cleaning cycle.  
    • Wiring diagram illustrates machine controls.  

• Description of the preferred embodiment 
    • Dry cleaner includes nested tubs and an outer cabinet.  
    • Operative elements include a drive motor and a pump for solvent.  
    • The header chamber allows air flow communication with the tubs.  
    • The machine operates through various cycles: wash, drain, spin, and dry.  

• Solvent flow system 
    • Stand-by condition has no solvent flow.  
    • Fill and wash cycle involves continuous solvent recirculation.  
    • Dump and spin cycle alters flow paths for filtration and draining.  
    • Last minute of the cycle includes a backwash operation.  

• Air flow system 
    • No airflow during stand-by and fill/wash cycles.  
    • Valves open during drain and spin for air pressure balance.  
    • Prevents airflow during spin to minimize streaks and swales.  
    • Airflow resumes during the drying portion of the cycle.  

• Solvent vapor handling 
    • Air/vapor mixture is retained in an expandable bag.  
    • Safety release valve maintains acceptable pressure levels.  
    • Vapor pressure stabilizes during

<summary>
• The invention claims priority from a U.S. Provisional Patent Application.  
	• The application is titled “Method and Apparatus For Forming A melt Spun Nonwoven Web.”  
• The invention focuses on spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing methods.  
	• It aims to improve upon existing eductive and non-eductive spinning systems.  
• Conventional eductive systems create turbulence and filament entanglement, affecting product uniformity.  
	• These systems also face hygiene issues and require complex air supply setups.  
• Non-eductive systems allow for better web formation control but have limitations on fiber spin speeds.  
	• Structural loads from pressurized quench fluids restrict operational parameters.  
• The invention introduces a continuous two-dimensional slot for filament drawing, enhancing uniformity.  
	• This design simplifies the process and reduces cleaning time compared to traditional systems.  
• The method allows for flexible processing of various thermoplastic polymers and other materials.  
	• Parameters such as quench air temperature and flow rates are critical for filament properties.  
• The system can produce fine continuous filaments for various applications, including nonwoven fabrics.  
	• It offers advantages in production rates and material versatility for end products.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims priority to a Japanese patent application.
    • It relates to a sewing machine and an embroidery unit.
    • The focus is on controlling sewing positions on work cloth.
    • The content is incorporated by reference.

• Current sewing machines require markers for positioning.
    • Users must affix and later remove markers.
    • This process can be cumbersome.
    • The invention aims to simplify this operation.

• The sewing machine includes detecting portions for ultrasonic waves.
    • It identifies the position of the ultrasonic wave source.
    • The sewing process is controlled based on this position.
    • This eliminates the need for physical markers.

• An embroidery unit can be attached to the sewing machine.
    • It holds an embroidery frame for the work cloth.
    • The unit also detects ultrasonic waves.
    • It moves the work cloth based on detected positions.

• A non-transitory computer-readable medium stores control programs.
    • The program identifies the ultrasonic wave source position.
    • It controls sewing based on this identified position.
    • This enhances the sewing machine's functionality.

• The sewing machine's configuration is detailed in various figures.
    • It includes components like the bed, arm, and head.
    • Receivers for ultrasonic detection are strategically placed.
    • The design facilitates accurate position identification.

• The ultrasonic pen allows users to specify sewing positions.
    • It transmits ultrasonic waves when pressed against the cloth.
    • The sewing machine detects these waves for positioning.
    • This method improves user experience and accuracy.

• The document outlines multiple embodiments of the invention.
    • Each embodiment presents variations in receiver placement.
    • Different configurations are explored for enhanced functionality.
    • The goal is to maintain precision in sewing operations.

• The invention is not limited to the described embodiments.
    • Modifications can be made to the receiver placements.
    • The ultrasonic pen can operate wirelessly.
    • The sewing machine can detect waves from external sources.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabrics through functional additives.  
    • The preparations include wool or bamboo particles as carriers for these additives.  
    • The goal is to improve properties like UV protection, antibacterial effects, and moisture management.  
    • The methods involve pulverizing these materials to create ultrafine powders for better retention and performance.  
• The application methods for the preparations include printing, padding, and foam application.  
    • These methods ensure the functional additives are effectively bonded to the fabric.  
    • The treated fabrics demonstrate improved durability after multiple washes.  
    • Testing shows enhanced properties such as wicking, wrinkle recovery, and antibacterial effectiveness.  
    • The results indicate significant improvements in performance compared to untreated fabrics.  
• The use of ultrafine wool and bamboo powders is both environmentally friendly and economical.  
    • These materials are often sourced from by-products that would otherwise be discarded.  
    • The ultrafine size allows for better integration into the fabric structure.  
    • The preparations can be tailored to achieve specific functional properties desired in textiles.  
    • The invention aims to provide a sustainable solution for functional textiles in the market.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to an automatic quilting machine designed for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads and quilts.  
    • The machine features a large metal frame that holds the fabric securely while allowing for movement in the X and Y directions.  
    • It utilizes a sewing machine head that is fixed in place, with the fabric being moved relative to it to achieve the desired stitching pattern.  
    • The system is controlled by two separate computers: one for the sewing machine functions and another for the table movement.  
• A significant improvement of the invention is the ability to independently program the sewing and movement functions.  
    • This separation allows for easier modifications to either the stitch patterns or the table movements without requiring a complete reprogramming of the entire system.  
    • The operator can draw patterns on a monitor using a computer-aided design program, which converts the drawings into machine-readable commands.  
    • The system can duplicate patterns across the fabric based on the operator's input, enhancing efficiency and production rates.  
    • The invention aims to streamline the quilting process, reducing the time and effort needed for programming and pattern adjustments.  
• The machine is designed to accommodate both computer-generated patterns and hand-selected designs.  
    • It increases the production rate of hand-guided patterns sewn into large fabrics.  
    • The system eliminates the need for traditional digitizer boards by allowing direct input through a CAD program.  
    • The overall design promotes ease of use and flexibility in pattern creation and execution.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a method for manufacturing two-sided nonwoven fabrics.
    * The fabrics exhibit a three-dimensional image suitable for various consumer applications.
    * The process is more efficient than traditional textile methods, which involve multiple complex steps.
    * Nonwoven fabrics are produced directly from the carding process, enhancing economic advantages.
    * Hydroentangled fabrics improve properties like elongation and durability through composite structures.

* The method involves using precursor webs and a support layer during hydroentanglement.
    * A first and second fibrous matrix are used, separated by a fluid-pervious support layer.
    * The hydroentanglement process imparts a durable three-dimensional image to the fabric.
    * The fabric can be treated post-entanglement for enhanced performance or aesthetics.
    * Applications include hygiene products, medical materials, and various consumer goods.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a device for feeding material into sewing machines.
	* It aims to improve the sewing process for stiff strips of material like cardboard and leather.
* Existing devices rely on the needle as a stop, which can deform with stiff materials.
	* This deformation can lead to erroneous stitches and damage to the sewing machine.
* The new device allows for continuous operation without manual intervention.
	* It uses a stop that can be moved into and out of the feed path of the strip.
* The control means includes a signal transmitter that activates sewing machine functions.
	* This allows for the strip to be positioned correctly before sewing begins.
* The device features a two-armed lever biased by a spring for stop movement.
	* The stop can be adjusted using an air cylinder for precise positioning.
* The sewing machine includes a guide chute for the strip of material.
	* The stop interacts with the strip to control the sewing operation effectively.
* The operation sequence is automated, enhancing efficiency and reducing errors.
	* The system ensures that the presser foot and needle are correctly positioned before sewing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a knitting method and knit fabric for various garment parts.
	* * It specifically addresses the collar of sweaters, neck ropes of tank tops, and other similar applications.
* Traditional methods involve separate sewing processes that reduce productivity.
	* * These methods can lead to irregularities and increased manufacturing costs.
* The invention introduces a connective knitting method for two tape-shaped knit pieces.
	* * This method utilizes a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* The knitting process involves overlaying loops from two knit pieces to join them.
	* * This is done gradually, depending on the width of the knit fabric.
* The method allows for the end portions of the knit fabrics to be joined without additional sewing.
	* * This enhances both the appearance and comfort of the final product.
* The knitting machine can have multiple needle beds, with at least one being movable.
	* * The design allows for flexibility in knitting various fabric types.
* The process includes specific steps for transferring and overlaying loops.
	* * This ensures a secure and neat junction between the two knit pieces.
* The invention can be applied to various garment parts beyond sweaters.
	* * Examples include tank tops, baseball stockings, and aprons.
* The knitting method is controlled by a computer following a designed pattern.
	* * This automation improves consistency and efficiency in production.
* The overall goal is to create a seamless and aesthetically pleasing knit fabric.
	* * This method addresses the shortcomings of traditional sewing techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a flexible traction element for lifts.
    * It consists of stranded cables made from tensile strength materials.
    * A production line is designed for embedding these cables in thermoplastic materials.
    * The method enhances flexibility and adhesion between cables and the jacket.
    * The traction element can be wound and unwound easily.

* The production line includes various components for processing stranded cables.
    * It features reels, heaters, extruders, and cooling troughs.
    * The extruder has a thread guide and adjustable matrix for precise cable positioning.
    * Pressure rollers help maintain the spacing and surface structure of the cables.
    * The process allows for high-speed production of traction elements.

* The method for embedding stranded cables involves several steps.
    * Cables are degreased and preheated before coating.
    * The coating is applied using liquefied thermoplastic materials.
    * The process ensures improved adhesion and durability of the traction elements.
    * Tensioning of cables is controlled to maintain quality during production.

* The traction elements have specific design features for optimal performance.
    * They can have various cross-sectional shapes and dimensions.
    * The outer jacket can be structured to enhance friction and stability.
    * The design accommodates different diameters of stranded cables.
    * They are suitable for lifting and pulling loads in various applications.

* The invention offers significant advantages in industrial applications.
    * It meets high safety requirements for lift bands and cables.
    * The traction elements can also function as electric conductors.
    * They exhibit long-term durability even under high tensile forces.
    * The production process is efficient, achieving speeds of 10 to 60 m/min.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a rotary hook arrangement for lockstitch sewing machines.
	* * It aims to minimize hindrance during the guiding and pull-back of the needle thread loop.
	* * The design features holding means positioned to avoid interference with thread movement.

* The rotary hook includes a spring rod and two cams to control the bobbin housing's rotation.
	* * The spring rod allows for slight bending, which only minimally increases needle thread tension.
	* * The arrangement ensures that the needle thread loop can move freely during operation.

* A capsule release device is incorporated to provide a rotational impulse to the bobbin housing.
	* * This device creates a temporary gap that facilitates unhindered movement of the needle thread loop.
	* * It allows for reduced needle thread tension during stitch formation.

* The sewing machine design is characterized by simplicity, durability, and cost-effectiveness.
	* * The rotary hook operates efficiently, providing smooth and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop.
	* * The invention maintains good sewing properties even without the capsule release device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on methods for producing silicon-based nanostructures.
    * It utilizes four-component and five-component inks comprising liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents.
    * The electrospinning technique allows for continuous manufacturing of silicon nanowires and films.
    * Applications include use in batteries, sensors, and electronic devices.

* The electrospinning process is enhanced by the use of specific liquid silanes and polymers.
    * Cyclohexasilane (Si6H12) is a preferred silane due to its stability and ability to form nanowires.
    * The process can produce fibers with diameters ranging from 1 nm to 2000 nm.
    * Thermal treatment transforms the deposited fibers into amorphous or crystalline silicon.
    * Coatings of conductive materials can be applied to enhance electrical properties.

* The invention claims priority from earlier applications and involves federally sponsored research.
    * It is a continuation of a PCT international application and claims the benefit of a U.S. provisional patent.
    * Government support was provided by the National Science Foundation and the DoD Defense Microelectronics Activity.
    * The methods aim to address challenges in silicon-based anode materials for lithium-ion batteries.
    * The resulting materials are expected to improve energy density and mechanical stability in battery applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to thread tension control in spool creels.
	* It features adjustable braking elements influenced by thread tension and weight.
* Existing systems allow for automatic reduction of braking force as spool diameter decreases.
	* However, they often lack individual control over each spool's tension.
* The invention provides a centralized fluid pressure system for controlling tension across multiple spools.
	* This allows for simultaneous adjustments to thread tension for the entire creel.
* A pneumatic biasing arrangement enhances the tensioning lever's operation without hindering its movement.
	* The system can quickly increase braking force when the warping machine is shut off.
* Preferred angles for the tensioning lever and biasing arrangement optimize force application.
	* This ensures consistent tension control across the entire operational range.
* An alternative embodiment utilizes an electromagnetic brake system for tension control.
	* This system generates eddy currents in a braking disc to adjust braking force based on lever position.
</summary>

<summary>
• Overview of the Invention  
    • The invention is a sewing machine detector that identifies the position of the sewing needle and the machine's speed.  
    • It integrates with the sewing machine's drive and control elements.  
    • The design aims to be durable and compact, addressing issues found in conventional detectors.  
    • It minimizes stress on optical fibers and avoids electrical interference with the control circuit.  

• Description of Conventional Detectors  
    • Conventional detectors use optical fibers for both sending and receiving light signals.  
    • They are prone to issues such as vibration and misalignment due to wear and tear.  
    • Reflective discs used in these detectors are expensive and difficult to manufacture.  
    • The design can lead to significant stress on optical fibers, risking damage and reducing efficiency.  

• Features of the Preferred Embodiment  
    • The new design employs flat light shielding discs to detect various positions and speeds.  
    • Optical fibers are supported linearly to reduce stress and maintain alignment.  
    • A power indicating optical fiber is included to avoid interference with control circuitry.  
    • The assembly allows for easy adjustment and accurate optical axis generation, enhancing stability.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention presents a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
	* The process includes critical operations such as completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline pH water, and drying, resulting in a finished yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45.

* The process improves efficiency by reducing the number of treatments and space required for spinning machines without compromising quality.
	* It allows for spinning speeds of at least 90 m/min and utilizes water with specific chemical compositions to achieve desired results.

* Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method yields significantly higher degrees of white compared to traditional processes.
	* Analytical data shows that the reduction of sulphur from sulphides correlates with improved whiteness, confirming the effectiveness of the new process.
</summary>

<summary>
* Related Cases
    * Continuation-in-part of patent application Ser. No. 594,455.
    * Original application filed on Mar. 29, 1984.
    * Current application is now abandoned.
    * Focuses on improvements in pulp bleaching processes.
    
* Background of the Invention
    * Problem with oxygen bleaching: foam formation during washing.
    * Existing solutions include the "Deculator" process and various patents.
    * Current systems are expensive and require large equipment.
    * Need for a smaller, efficient deaeration tank identified.

* Summary of the Invention
    * Development of a small deaeration tank for pulp treatment.
    * Designed to operate at atmospheric or low pressure.
    * No moving parts to reduce maintenance and complexity.
    * System allows for recovery of steam or oxygen.

* Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    * Overall oxygen process involves multiple stages from pumping to washing.
    * Deaeration tank features an inlet pipe and swirl-inducing design.
    * Filtrate from the washer is used to create swirl for optimal deaeration.
    * Consistency of pulp maintained between 1% and 5%.

* Deaeration Tank Specifications
    * Tank dimensions are proportional to the oxygen reactor.
    * Inlet and outlet pipes are strategically placed for efficiency.
    * Tank can be closed for pressure or vacuum operation.
    * Specific measurements provided for a 50-ton pulp per day installation.

* Operational Details
    * Filtrate enters the tank at high velocity to enhance deaeration.
    * Emergency bypass line included for system stability.
    * Height sensors control pulp flow and maintain consistency.
    * Design allows for easy integration with existing systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials that enhance structural performance, particularly in terms of out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.  
    • The design methodology, known as function-oriented material design (FOMD), optimizes material distribution and structural configurations to meet specific functional requirements.  
• BTR composites consist of stuffer members and tendon elements arranged in various configurations, including flat and curved panels, to achieve desired mechanical properties.  
    • These composites can incorporate a range of materials, including carbon fibers and polymers, and can be tailored for applications such as lightweight aircraft and protective armor.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device designed for braced frame structures to dissipate energy during dynamic events.
    • The device can undergo plastic deformation to limit loads on critical structural components.
    • It is easily replaceable after deformation, enhancing the repairability of the structure.
    • The device aims to prevent extensive damage during seismic events, improving overall building safety.

• The prior art highlights the challenges faced by traditional braced frame systems during seismic events.
    • Many existing systems suffer from severe damage, leading to costly repairs or total destruction.
    • Innovations like hydraulic dampers have limitations, including maintenance challenges and integration difficulties.
    • The proposed device offers a more effective solution by allowing controlled energy dissipation without significant structural damage.

• The invention includes various embodiments and methods for integrating the load-limiting device into existing structures.
    • It can be connected using different means, such as bolts or welds, to accommodate various structural designs.
    • The device's geometry can be adapted for different bracing configurations, ensuring versatility.
    • An indicator means may be included to facilitate the detection of plastic deformation after dynamic events.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a box-shaped bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities, optimizing space for individual sleeping areas.
	* The cabinet features dual construction for enhanced strength, flat external surfaces for stacking, and integrated storage for devices without protruding into the living space.
* The cabinet includes an inner casing with various compartments for amenities like TVs and interphones, and a ventilation system for improved airflow and soundproofing.
	* Spacer members create a clearance for wiring and ventilation, contributing to the overall functionality and comfort of the cabinet.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a portable guard rail support system.  
    • It is designed for temporary safety barriers at construction sites.  
    • The system aims to enhance worker safety during construction activities.  
 
• Safety barriers are essential in modern construction, especially for high-rise buildings.  
    • They prevent accidental falls from uncompleted floors.  
    • They also protect against the dislodgement of materials that could harm workers below.  

• Traditional methods of constructing guard rails are labor-intensive and inefficient.  
    • They often involve using lumber that can be damaged and not reusable.  
    • These methods can lead to increased costs and safety compliance issues.  

• There is a need for a simple and effective guard rail system.  
    • The system should be easy to assemble and disassemble.  
    • It must meet safety guidelines and provide adequate fall protection.  

• The guard rail support includes several key components.  
    • It features a flat base plate, an upright column, and support brackets.  
    • It also has a kick board retaining flange and a safety tie-off ring.  

• An alternative concrete-filled steel base is available for stability.  
    • This base allows for use where anchoring to the ground is not feasible.  
    • It includes a groove for the guard rail support to slide into for secure placement.  

• The guard rail system can accommodate various configurations.  
    • It can support wooden guard rails or mesh-like structures.  
    • The design allows for overlapping or stub configurations for flexibility.  

• The system adheres to safety regulations regarding height and spacing.  
    • The top rail must be between 3 to 3.5 feet above the floor.  
    • Supports should be spaced no more than 8 feet apart for safety.  

• The guard rail supports are designed for easy installation and removal.  
    • A single worker can install the system without assistance.  
    • The design minimizes damage to materials during disassembly.  

• The invention can be adapted for various applications beyond construction sites.  
    • It can be used for temporary railings on roofs or bridges.  
    • The guard rail support system is versatile for different environments.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on enhancing crude oil recovery from reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
	* The method aims to overcome limitations of existing techniques by generating high-frequency acoustic vibrations and electromagnetic pulses that stimulate oil flow over greater distances than traditional methods.
* The system includes various embodiments such as multi-level discharge devices and customizable pulse sources to optimize stimulation based on reservoir characteristics.
	* These innovations allow for improved efficiency in oil extraction and the separation of recovered hydrocarbons into their components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application is a continuation-in-part of a previous patent related to soil reinforcing connectors.
	* It discusses Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures used for various applications like retaining walls and dams.
	* The technology involves layering backfill and soil reinforcing elements to create stable earthen structures.
	* A need for a system to splice soil reinforcing elements to extend their length is identified.

* The disclosure introduces a splice for soil reinforcing elements.
	* The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to secure transverse wires from both the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
	* Connective devices are used to couple the wave plates and clamp the longitudinal wires, preventing lateral movement.
	* Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to achieve the desired length for reinforcement.

* The detailed description emphasizes the versatility of the splice design.
	* It allows for various configurations and arrangements of soil reinforcing elements.
	* The transverse wires can be spaced differently, and the splice can accommodate irregular spacing.
	* The design can be adapted to different applications without departing from the scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a novel plow blade design that incorporates fluid passageways for improved utility line installation.
    * The blade allows for efficient fluid ejection to reduce friction and power requirements during plowing.
    * It features a multi-component assembly that enables easy replacement of worn parts.
    * Various configurations can be tailored to specific job requirements by adjusting fluid flow paths and nozzle placements.
    * Traditional manufacturing processes are utilized, making the blade cost-effective to produce and maintain.

* The detailed description outlines multiple embodiments of the plow blade, each with unique fluid routing mechanisms.
    * Fluid tubes can be positioned in different locations to optimize fluid pressure and ejection points.
    * Manifolds and voids are used to control fluid flow and injection rates effectively.
    * The design allows for modifications using standard tools, enhancing versatility for different applications.
    * The overall structure aims to improve the efficiency of utility line installation while minimizing manufacturing complexity.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction.
    • The system allows for larger panels exceeding 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without mandatory movement joints.
    • It aims to provide compliance with New Zealand building codes NZS3604 and plaster code NZS4251.
    • The system includes various assemblies, subassemblies, and methods for construction.
    
• The construction involves a reinforced plaster panel supported by a frame or substructure.
    • The wall consists of battens, inner and outer meshes, and a multi-layer plaster matrix.
    • Openings for doors and windows are reinforced within the plaster matrix.
    • The system accommodates movement control joints as required by regulations.

• The materials used include treated timber battens, galvanized steel mesh, and proprietary plaster.
    • The plaster is applied in multiple layers for durability and structural integrity.
    • Reinforcement is provided at corners and around openings to enhance strength.
    • The system is designed to resist wind loads and moisture penetration.

• The invention includes specific components and consumables for construction.
    • These components are designed to meet performance requirements of the New Zealand Building Code.
    • The system allows for the construction of decks and other structures.
    • It emphasizes the importance of moisture management and sealing for longevity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a new and improved safe structure designed for containing valuable items.
	* It features a valuables receiving chamber with a rectangular opening and a steel door that can be easily assembled and locked.
	* The design includes inwardly extending ledges and grooves for secure door placement and retention.
	* Reinforcing bolts and a lock assembly enhance security against forced entry.

* The safe can be constructed using various materials, including plastic and metal, and can be embedded in concrete.
	* The construction allows for a "do it yourself" assembly, making it cost-effective and accessible for residential use.
	* The design incorporates safety features to protect the locking mechanism from damage during attempted break-ins.
	* Variations in the design can accommodate different configurations and materials while maintaining structural integrity.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to improved techniques for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations.
    • The goal is to accurately measure pressure at a specific depth without interference from surrounding pressures.
    • Applications are relevant to civil engineering, hydro-geology, and petroleum engineering.
    • Traditional methods, like standpipe piezometers, have limitations due to their volume and connection issues.

• New methods involve using pressure transducers and cement grouting techniques.
    • A conduit with a filter is cemented in place, allowing for direct pressure measurement from the formation.
    • Fluid is injected to clear cement from the filter and establish a connection to the formation.
    • The system can include features like check valves and packers for better pressure management.

• The invention addresses the need for isolation of pressure sensors in boreholes.
    • This isolation prevents measurement interference from pressures above or below the sensor.
    • The method allows for multiple sensors to be installed in a single operation.
    • It enhances the accuracy of pressure readings in low permeability formations.

• Various embodiments of the invention are described for different applications.
    • These include configurations for groundwater monitoring and petroleum reservoir assessments.
    • The systems can be designed for easy access and maintenance of pressure transducers.
    • The use of hydrofracturing techniques is also proposed to enhance fluid connectivity.

• The detailed installation process is illustrated through figures.
    • Steps include drilling a borehole, installing a grout pipe, and setting up the pressure sensor arrangement.
    • The process emphasizes the importance of timing during cement setting for optimal results.
    • Graphical data shows pressure changes during the installation and monitoring phases.

• The invention aims to provide reliable and accurate pressure measurements in geological formations.
    • It offers solutions to challenges faced by traditional pressure measurement systems.
    • The technology is adaptable to various geological conditions and monitoring needs.
    • Future developments may further refine the methods and applications of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
	* The invention pertains to a jointing structure for vehicle traveling paths with an expansion function, applicable to transit systems and road bridges.

* Related Art Challenges
	* Existing rubber and steel expansion joints face issues with slip resistance, durability, and safety, leading to potential tire fall-in situations.

* Objectives of the Invention
	* The invention aims to provide a jointing structure that accommodates various tire configurations, enhances slip resistance, and simplifies maintenance.

* Structural Features
	* The jointing structure includes multiple steps with elastic members and a joint block that maintains the expansion gap while preventing tire fall-in.

* Elastic Member Design
	* The elastic members are designed to be hard to deform vertically but easy to deform horizontally, primarily using laminated rubber.

* Maintenance and Adaptability
	* The components are detachable for easy maintenance, and the design allows for adjustments based on seasonal and temperature changes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to floor track systems for transporting food products in sanitary environments.
	* * It addresses issues with conventional air chilling methods that lead to dehydration of meat products.
	* * The invention aims to maintain sanitary conditions while allowing for efficient transport of meat products.

* Recent methods use chilled brine solutions for rapid cooling of meat products.
	* * This requires a system that can recover and recirculate the brine solution economically.
	* * Sanitary conditions must be preserved during the transport of meat into and out of treatment chambers.

* Overhead rail systems have limitations, including fixed routes and contamination risks.
	* * Contaminated brine cannot be reused without sterilization.
	* * The invention seeks to eliminate contamination from transport wheels.

* Wheeled dolly-like trucks offer mobility but risk contamination from the processing floor.
	* * The invention proposes a system that allows for the use of these trucks without compromising sanitation.
	* * It aims to prevent contamination of the cooling brine solution.

* The enclosed floor track system prevents the wheels of hand trucks from contacting the treatment fluid.
	* * It includes a wheel channel that is elevated above the fluid level.
	* * The design allows for easy cleaning and maintenance of the track system.

* Two embodiments of the track system are described: one with a cover plate and another with inflatable seals.
	* * The cover plate design allows for cleaning while preventing fluid entry.
	* * The inflatable seals create a barrier around the wheel struts to maintain sanitation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lock device for construction machines, specifically to prevent the downward rotation of a backhoe boom due to its weight.
	* The device includes an engaging member and an engaged member that allows for easy manual lock operation.
* Conventional methods for locking work machines have issues with friction and wear, leading to reduced lifespan of components.
	* The proposed lock device aims to simplify the locking mechanism and reduce the number of parts required.
* The lock device features a hook part and a slot, allowing the engaging member to slide and maintain its position during operation.
	* It is designed to automatically return to the release position even if vibrations occur during travel.
* An alternative embodiment of the lock device is described, where the lock plate is mounted on the boom bracket instead of the boom.
	* This design also incorporates a slip-prevention mechanism to enhance stability and ease of assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to swimming pool vacuum cleaning devices.  
	• It features a flexible platform with an adjustable vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.  
• Prior art devices typically require manual adjustment of suction heads.  
	• This process is cumbersome and inefficient for commercial pool cleaning operators.  
• The invention allows for real-time suction adjustment directly on the vacuum head.  
	• Adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the suction head.  
• The design includes a central suction portion and outboard roller assemblies.  
	• The outboard rollers can be adjusted using wing nuts for height regulation.  
• A unique frame member spans the platform, facilitating the adjustment of inboard rollers.  
	• The frame members are designed to accommodate existing roller constructions with minimal modifications.  
• The invention can be retrofitted to existing devices with a simple kit.  
	• The kit includes frames, connectors, wing nuts, springs, and axles for easy assembly.  
• The adjustment mechanism enhances suction control without needing to modify the suction source.  
	• This feature allows for precise regulation of suction during pool cleaning operations.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to oil well drilling tools, specifically an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from well heads and casings.
	* It addresses the limitations of existing methods that require the drill bit for retrieval, allowing for removal without it.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that can slide vertically while preventing rotation.
	* This design allows for vertical play to avoid damaging the wear bushing during retrieval attempts.
* The retriever section is equipped with protruding members that engage with a J-slot in the wear bushing for secure retrieval.
	* The apparatus can be installed between sections of drill pipe without needing to remove the drill bit.
* An alternative embodiment features a threaded retriever section for engaging threaded wear bushings.
	* This allows for a different method of retrieval while maintaining the core functionality of the apparatus.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools that allow for the passage of other tools through them.  
	• The tool is designed to dislodge stuck objects (fish) in wellbores while enabling wireline access.  
• Previous vibratory tools had limitations, such as obstructed central passageways and rapid wear of components.  
	• The new design features an annular dump valve that keeps the center clear for wireline operations.  
• The tool utilizes stacked pistons to enhance power delivery and reliability compared to prior designs.  
	• This modular design allows for customization based on specific downhole conditions and requirements.  
• The tool can operate with or without impacts, providing flexibility in its application for fishing or stimulation operations.  
	• It relies on a single valve for operation, which reduces wear and increases the tool's lifespan.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a precast concrete retaining wall system designed for taller walls and shorter bases.
    • The system consists of a precast face panel with an integral counterfort and a solid precast base.
    • The assembly allows for immediate stability without the need for temporary shoring during installation.
    • Custom sizes for components can be easily manufactured, enhancing flexibility in design.
    • The connection between the face panel and base is secured using rebar and grout, ensuring structural integrity.

• The invention addresses limitations of prior art retaining walls, particularly regarding height and installation challenges.
    • Traditional methods often require extensive excavation and temporary supports, limiting wall height to 10-12 feet.
    • The new design minimizes on-site labor and costs by utilizing pre-manufactured components.
    • Additional features, such as drainage openings and shear keys, improve performance and stability.
    • The system can incorporate vehicle impact barriers, either cast-in-place or precast, for enhanced safety.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on improving down hole heating systems for oil and gas wells.  
    • The system aims to enhance production by addressing issues related to oil viscosity and paraffin blockage.  
    • It emphasizes the need for effective heat concentration in the production zone to facilitate flow.  
• Existing down hole heating technologies have significant shortcomings.  
    • Conventional systems often fail due to inadequate protection against chemical and physical damage.  
    • They do not effectively focus heat where it is needed, leading to inefficient production.  
• The proposed system includes innovative design features for durability and efficiency.  
    • It utilizes heat insulating components to retain heat in the desired area.  
    • The electrical connections are shielded to prevent failures from hostile well conditions.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
	* * Relates to down hole tools for mechanical activities in wells.
	* * Focuses on mechanisms for installing and removing stuck or lost objects in well bores.

* Background Context
	* * Addresses issues with existing pull tools and fishing operations.
	* * Highlights problems with disconnection from worn fishing necks.

* Fishing Operations
	* * Objects stuck in wells are referred to as "fish."
	* * Various tools have been developed for fishing operations, often using wire line.

* Tool Design
	* * The invention includes external pull tools (overshots) and internal pull tools (spears).
	* * Tools consist of an outer tubular body and an inner body structure for gripping objects.

* Locking Mechanism
	* * Features a catch mechanism with locking and unlocking positions.
	* * Utilizes a pin structure and control spring for operation.

* Operation of Pull Tool
	* * Unlocking occurs through simple mechanical movements.
	* * Allows for easy switching between tools of different pulling capacities.

* Preferred Embodiment
	* * Describes a specific design with adjustable components for accurate positioning.
	* * Incorporates a compression spring to maintain tool positioning.

* Overshot Mechanism
	* * Includes a latching control element for engaging and disengaging from objects.
	* * Allows for repeated latching and unlatching without removing the tool from the well.

* Versatility of Invention
	* * Intended for various down hole service operations, including fishing and tool installation.
	* * Emphasizes adaptability to different operational needs and conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims priority from previous patent applications related to stave floors.  
		• The focus is on modular composed stave floors.  
		• The related applications highlight issues with existing stave floor designs.  
• Existing stave floors have significant drawbacks, including thin sight substrates and reliance on glue for assembly.  
		• Thin substrates lead to deformation and poor durability.  
		• Current methods do not effectively prevent displacement or dimensional changes.  
• The proposed method improves stave floor construction by using thicker substrates and multidirectional holding means.  
		• This approach enhances durability and allows for corrective maintenance.  
		• The use of advanced materials and techniques aims to preserve the aesthetic and functional properties of the floors.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments that enhance stability and protect work surfaces.
	* * It addresses issues of ladder instability and potential damage to surfaces during use.
	* * The design allows for broader contact areas and prevents slipping or sliding.

* The ladder attachments include a brace with a resilient pad assembly.
	* * The brace is secured to the ladder using a U-bolt and can pivot for better contact.
	* * The design allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.

* The preferred embodiment features interchangeable brace assemblies for both siderails.
	* * Each assembly includes an arm with a flange and a clamp for secure attachment.
	* * The assemblies can accommodate different ladder sizes through adjustable components.

* The invention emphasizes non-slip gripping and increased contact area for safety.
	* * It aims to prevent damage to work surfaces while providing lateral stability.
	* * Various modifications and applications of the design are possible without departing from the core invention.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a collated nail strip made from a debris-free plastic material for use in fastener driving tools.  
    • The nail strip is designed to minimize debris generation during driving by ensuring that the plastic collar remains adhered to the nail shank.  
    • The plastic material is molded onto the fasteners and includes a collar that encircles the shank and a connecting portion between adjacent collars.  
    • The system aims to enhance rigidity, reduce flexing, and allow for coiling of the strips for specific tool applications.  
• The method for creating the fastener assembly involves preheating the nails before molding the plastic material onto them.  
    • Preheating improves adhesion and reduces debris by allowing the plastic to penetrate the substrate with the nail.  
    • The assembly can be configured to encourage separation of fasteners at desired locations to further minimize debris.  
    • Various structural configurations, such as tapered collars and preferentially weakened regions, are employed to enhance performance and reduce debris.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a nozzle for applying sealants in various industries.
	• The nozzle features a bell or hood lower section and an injection button.
	• It is designed for use in aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics industries.

• Current nozzles have limitations in precision and compatibility with different sealant application methods.
	• Existing metal nozzles require hazardous cleaning solvents.
	• They lack the ability to apply sealants accurately in tight spaces.

• The nozzle aims to improve sealant application efficiency and precision.
	• It allows for both manual and automated application methods.
	• The design facilitates encapsulation of rivets and screws.

• The nozzle consists of a main elongated body, a connecting section, and a bell-shaped section.
	• The connecting section features a threaded exterior for compatibility with cartridges.
	• The bell-shaped section is designed to cover rivets and nuts completely.

• Two embodiments of the nozzle are described, each with a unique injection button design.
	• The first button has radially oriented channels for precise sealant flow.
	• The second button includes lateral openings for directing sealant around screws.

• The nozzle simplifies sealing operations and enhances the quality of sealant application.
	• It reduces application time and labor costs.
	• The design allows for a traditional nozzle shape for other sealing tasks after use.
</summary>

<summary>
* This application claims the benefit of two U.S. Provisional Applications.
    * Both applications relate to position and motion sensors.
    * Filed on November 25, 2003.
    * Disclosures are incorporated by reference.

* The invention addresses the need for monitoring moving parts in mechanical systems.
    * Examples include diesel engine fuel injectors.
    * Timing and speed of fuel injection depend on fuel characteristics.
    * Biodiesel fuels present unique challenges due to their properties.

* Mechanical systems often require multiple sensors for monitoring.
    * Each injector in an engine typically needs a separate sensor.
    * Wiring for these sensors must withstand extreme conditions.
    * Reducing wiring complexity can lower costs and weight.

* A method for reducing wiring is proposed using current changes.
    * Sensors can operate with only two wires for power and ground.
    * Current drawn by the sensor indicates the position of the monitored object.
    * Voltage drop across an inline resistor provides a measurable signal.

* Multiplexing can further reduce the number of wires needed.
    * Sensors can share a common set of wires.
    * Timing information helps identify which sensor is active.
    * This method is efficient for systems with synchronized operations.

* Position sensors generate signals proportional to object distance.
    * Noise can interfere with the desired position signal.
    * Noise is categorized into low and high frequency.
    * High frequency noise can be filtered out easily.

* Low frequency noise presents challenges for two-wire sensors.
    * Static DC offsets can affect sensor reliability.
    * Increased current through sensors can lead to power dissipation.
    * Sensors should minimize current draw during power-up.

* The invention includes a sensor signal conditioner for error correction.
    * It modifies sensing signals to remove unnecessary power.
    * A waveform generator and error correction generator are utilized.
    * The system aims to maintain a conditioned sensing signal.

* A closed-loop compensation circuit is proposed for error correction.
    * It compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value.
    * Adjustments are made to eliminate static and error signals.
    * The system ensures accurate position indication without excess circuitry.

* The sensor design allows for rapid recalibration and low current draw.
    * It can be recalibrated by simply removing and reapplying power.
    * The output signal is modulated for effective communication.
    * The design accommodates sudden changes in system parameters.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
	* * It aims to improve valve control for better engine performance and fuel efficiency.
* Traditional valve systems use springs for closing valves, which limits engine speed and efficiency.
	* * The proposed system eliminates springs, allowing for higher engine speeds and reduced energy loss.
* The valve actuation system allows for infinitely variable control of valve openings.
	* * This enables precise adjustments to the amount of air/gas mixture entering the engine.
* The system can operate any number of cylinders independently for optimal fuel consumption.
	* * For example, it can deactivate cylinders when the vehicle is stopped or cruising.
* The design includes a rotary cam and a translating mechanism for valve movement.
	* * The system can be computer-controlled for real-time adjustments based on engine performance.
* The invention provides a simplified and robust construction for valve actuation.
	* * This makes it easier to manufacture and install compared to traditional systems.
* The system is adaptable for engines with multiple valves per cylinder.
	* * It can control four or six valves using a single camshaft mechanism.
* Overall, the invention aims to enhance engine performance while significantly reducing gasoline consumption.
	* * It offers a more efficient delivery of power and improved operational characteristics.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to aquarium lighting, specifically using LEDs.  
	• The design aims to enhance the health and well-being of aquatic life through improved lighting solutions.  
	• The light member features a housing with a top side facing away from the aquarium and a bottom side facing into it.  
	• It includes a lighting control region with multiple control channels for different colors of light.  
		• Users can independently control white and blue light channels for customizable lighting effects.  
		• The design allows for a range of color temperatures adjustable between 3500K to 15,000K.  
• Light-emitting modules can be added or removed from the lighting control region.  
	• Each module is designed to emit either white or blue light and connects to the control channels.  
	• The system can incorporate remote control functionality and timers for automated lighting schedules.  
		• This allows for programmable on/off times and dimming effects for enhanced user experience.  
		• The light members can also be adapted for use in other settings, such as under kitchen cabinets.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines like gas turbines.
	* The apparatus aims to improve cooling efficiency and reduce material-related issues found in traditional designs.
	* It introduces separate inserts for cooling channel separation instead of casting them with the blade.

* Traditional gas turbine blades face challenges due to high ambient temperatures and the weight of cast components.
	* Current designs lead to thermal stresses and increased cooling air consumption.
	* The invention proposes a simpler and more adaptable design that reduces weight and thermal stress.

* The new design features holders for the inserts, allowing for easier assembly and better sealing.
	* Inserts can be made from various materials and can be adjusted for different cooling requirements.
	* The design allows for the possibility of replacing inserts to modify cooling channel configurations.

* Preferred embodiments include blades with U-shaped separating walls and integral material joints for added security.
	* The design is particularly beneficial for rotor blades operating at high speeds.
	* It allows for the potential removal of cast separating walls from existing blades for retrofitting with the new inserts.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a system for controlling fuel delivery in vehicles, allowing for both automatic and manual operation.
	• The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to optimize performance.
	• It ensures smooth transitions between control modes to prevent vehicle lurching or stalling.

• The system addresses deficiencies in prior art, such as limited throttle control during malfunctions.
	• An auxiliary control unit is activated during failures, but the invention allows full manual control without speed restrictions.
	• Safety is prioritized, enabling the driver to operate the vehicle effectively in various driving conditions.

• The control system can be integrated with continuously variable transmissions for optimal throttle management.
	• It allows manual control at high transmission ratios and automatic control at low ratios for improved efficiency.
	• Various subroutines and logic sequencers are employed to manage the operation of stepper and DC motors for throttle control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a waste fuel burner designed to efficiently combust wood waste and minimize particulate emissions.  
		• The burner operates with controlled air supply, allowing for effective combustion of fuels with high moisture content.  
		• It aims to meet environmental regulations by producing minimal particulate matter and reducing slag formation.  
• The burner features a dual combustion chamber system that utilizes swirl air and secondary combustion air to enhance efficiency and reduce emissions.  
		• The primary chamber maintains lower temperatures to prevent ash fusion, while the secondary chamber ensures complete combustion.  
		• The design allows for quick adjustments in fuel and air supply, improving response times compared to conventional burners.  
• The control system for the burner is designed to automatically adjust air and fuel flow based on BTU demand, ensuring optimal performance.  
		• It includes sensors to monitor temperatures and oxygen levels, allowing for precise control of combustion conditions.  
		• The system can be manually overridden, providing flexibility in operation.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to an efficient evaporative refrigeration system for air conditioning.
	* The system utilizes a heat exchanger to separate wet and dry air, preventing moisture addition to the cooled air.
	* It recirculates working air from the enclosure to maximize cooling efficiency.
* The design incorporates various features to enhance cooling performance.
	* Working air flows countercurrently to water in the heat exchanger, optimizing heat absorption.
	* Additional cooling can be achieved by integrating a vapor compression refrigeration unit for dehumidification.
* The apparatus is designed for energy efficiency compared to traditional vapor compression systems.
	* It operates with significantly lower power consumption (1 to 1.5 kilowatts) compared to 4 to 8 kilowatts for conventional units.
	* The system can achieve a cooling capacity comparable to larger vapor compression units while maintaining sensible cooling.
* Specific construction details enhance the system's effectiveness.
	* Tubular members in the heat exchanger are designed for optimal air flow and water distribution.
	* The system includes features like a bleed-down system to minimize contamination and maintain efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* The application claims the benefit of a prior U.S. patent application.
	* It focuses on pumps for pumping fluids, particularly liquid manure.
	* The need for improved pumps capable of high volumetric flow rates and high pressure is highlighted.

* The fluid pump design includes multiple pump heads in series.
	* Each pump head contains an impeller and conduits for fluid movement.
	* The design allows for common driving of the impellers through a drive structure.

* The pump heads are connected to facilitate fluid flow and maintain pressure.
	* The initial and final pump heads have distinct features for effective fluid transfer.
	* Intermediate pump heads combine characteristics of both initial and final heads.

* Various support structures are proposed for the pump assembly.
	* Examples include wheeled booms, hitching assemblies, and trailers.
	* These structures enable the pump to operate effectively in fluid reservoirs.

* The detailed description includes specific embodiments and configurations.
	* Figures illustrate the pump's design and operational features.
	* The modularity of the pump allows for easy maintenance and adjustments.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes that operate on fewer than all engine cylinders.  
    • This design reduces excess components, improving engine robustness.  
    • The system allows for selective braking horsepower by activating only a portion of the engine cylinders.  
    • It includes a hydraulic system controlled by an electronic module for efficient operation.  

• The engine braking method involves activating a compression release brake during the compression stroke of the piston.  
    • The brake system utilizes a solenoid and spool valve to control fluid pressure and piston movement.  
    • Activation allows venting of compressed air from the cylinder, enhancing braking efficiency.  
    • The system can be modified for different engine configurations and braking requirements.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and an auxiliary gearbox.  
    • The mounting link is designed to absorb extreme loads from events like blade-off incidents.  
    • Conventional gearboxes often require additional material to withstand such loads.  
    • The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin for selective retention.  
• The gearbox assembly connects to the engine and includes various components for torque transmission.  
    • It features driveshaft and peripheral load connections for auxiliary systems.  
    • The assembly constrains the gearbox in all six degrees of freedom without over-constraining.  
    • The design prevents damage during severe impacts by allowing some movement.  
• The mounting link allows for relative motion between the engine and gearbox under extreme loads.  
    • The female link receives the male link, which can translate after the pin is sheared.  
    • The interface dampens motion to protect the gearbox from destructive loads.  
    • The pin serves as a fusible link, designed to shear under specific load conditions.  
• The pin's shear characteristics are predetermined to protect the gearbox assembly.  
    • It is designed to withstand routine loads but break under extreme conditions.  
    • After a shear event, the links can still translate to prevent detachment.  
    • The pin can be replaced during maintenance, simplifying repairs.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a point cap system and balance pin apparatus for arrow shafts that improves upon traditional methods of attaching arrow points and balancing arrows.  
	* The system allows for adjustable weight and prevents dirt from entering the shaft, enhancing performance and usability.  
* The design includes a point adaptor and nock cap adaptor, facilitating secure attachment of various arrow points and nocks while minimizing stress on the arrow shaft.  
	* The components are made from lightweight materials, ensuring optimal performance and balance for modern archery equipment.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military training.
    • It aims to enhance realism in battlefield training conditions.
    • The device is designed for use with small arms, specifically the M16 automatic weapon.
    • It eliminates the need for blanks and blank fire adapters, reducing training costs.
    • The simulator produces sound and flash without modifying the weapon.
    
• The system includes a low-cost plastic housing containing pyrotechnic charges and an electrical ignition system.
    • The housing is designed to fit into the weapon's magazine breech.
    • It allows for automatic and semi-automatic firing modes.
    • The ignition occurs in a confined space, venting through the weapon's ejection port.
    • The design ensures safety by preventing dangerous pressurization.

• The electrical control circuit consists of multiple functional blocks for realistic operation.
    • Key components include a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillators, and firing control.
    • The circuit uses various electronic components like CMOS ICs, SCRs, and resistors.
    • It simulates operator actions during live fire through a microswitch connected to the weapon's bolt.
    • The system can be reset and controlled based on the weapon's operation.

• The expendable pyrotechnic charges are designed for cost-effective production.
    • Each charge is housed in a cup and ignited electrically via a bridge wire.
    • The pyrotechnic composition includes potassium perchlorate and aluminum.
    • The design allows for rapid pressure buildup and controlled venting.
    • The simulator mimics the sound and flash of actual gunfire.

• The invention aims to provide a reliable, low-maintenance training device for military personnel.
    • It enhances training realism while being reusable and cost-effective.
    • The device is packaged to resemble an M16 magazine for authenticity.
    • It interfaces with existing training systems like the Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES).
    • The invention allows for safe and effective training without the risks associated with live ammunition.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention aims to enhance the performance of internal combustion engines by optimizing air intake dynamics while reducing noise.
	• The air intake device includes a tank, two interconnected pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a control valve that adjusts based on engine load conditions.

• The design features a resonator effect from the tank and a narrow passage, which helps absorb intake noise while maintaining volumetric efficiency.
	• The control valve's operation is mapped to engine speed and load, ensuring optimal performance under varying conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part mounting bracket designed for easy installation of speakers or equipment on various surfaces.  
	• It allows for single-person installation without needing to support the weight of the object while securing it.  
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that can be used on poles, walls, or other structures.  
	• The adjustable bracket can be positioned conveniently before being secured to the stationary bracket.  
• The design includes features like tapered springs for alignment and integrated hooks and tabs for easy connection.  
	• This minimizes the need for tools and allows for quick adjustments during installation.  
• The pole clamp assembly accommodates various pole sizes and shapes, providing 360-degree horizontal adjustment.  
	• Wing nuts on the clamp prevent over-tightening while ensuring a secure fit.  
• The assembly is suitable for various applications, including loudspeakers, lighting, and video cameras, and is made from weather-resistant materials.  
	• Stainless steel components are preferred for durability in outdoor settings.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a modular burner system designed for various heat-utilizing appliances.
	• The burner optimizes combustion efficiency and minimizes emissions while allowing for the use of solid fuels.

• The burner features a combustion chamber with a unique airflow design to support primary, secondary, and tertiary combustion.
	• It includes components such as an ash pan, a cover, and a grill, all designed for safety and ease of use.

• The system allows for interchangeable appliances, including cookers, food smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
	• Each appliance can be easily attached or detached from the burner, enhancing versatility in heating applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the cooling and ignition system of rotary internal combustion engines to enhance fuel economy and durability.
	* * It focuses on improving the cooling characteristics around spark plug bosses to reduce thermal distortion and structural failures.
	* * The design incorporates staggered spark plug bosses to promote better coolant flow and heat transfer efficiency.

* The arrangement of spark plug bosses is critical for effective combustion and cooling.
	* * Dual in-line spark plugs are used to ensure complete combustion of the air-fuel mixture, but their arrangement can disrupt cooling flow.
	* * The staggered configuration of the bosses allows for improved coolant velocity distribution and reduced vapor accumulation.

* Experimental results demonstrate significant improvements in heat transfer coefficients with the staggered design.
	* * The staggered arrangement increased the heat transfer coefficient by approximately 44% compared to the in-line configuration.
	* * This design leads to a more uniform temperature distribution across the combustion surface, enhancing engine performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on minimizing flow disturbances in turbines during control valve testing.
	* The method utilizes control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant mass flow and minimize pressure changes.
* Existing methods for managing pressure changes during valve testing are limited and often ineffective.
	* Previous techniques either modify inlet pressure or require additional monitoring, which the current invention avoids.
* The proposed method calculates total mass flow based on control valve positions, adjusting for closed valves during testing.
	* This approach ensures that the remaining open valves compensate for the flow loss, maintaining system stability.
* Experimental results demonstrate a significant reduction in pressure excursions during valve testing with the new compensation method.
	* The control system showed a 95% reduction in pressure changes compared to tests without flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
    * Relates to mixing valves for combining fluids.
    * Specifically designed for aircraft cleaning apparatus.
    * Features two inlets (A and B) and one outlet.
    * Mixture can range from 0% A fluid to 100% B fluid and vice versa.

* Existing Cleaning Apparatus
    * Various forms of pressurized cleaning systems are known.
    * Examples include garden hoses and public car washes.
    * Previous patents describe similar cleaning mechanisms.
    * Larger systems for commercial aircraft cleaning are also referenced.

* Need for Improved Cleaning Systems
    * Aircraft cleaning is typically done by teams of employees.
    * Current methods involve bulky machinery and multiple cleaning agents.
    * A stand-alone apparatus is desired for efficiency.
    * Users should have control over cleaning solution strength.

* Mixing Valve Design
    * The valve includes a body with defined inlet and outlet passages.
    * Adjustable valve means directs fluid toward the outlet.
    * Mixture proportions can be adjusted continuously.
    * Designed to maintain constant pressure for each user.

* Valve Body Features
    * Contains a bore with varying diameters for fluid flow.
    * Inlet passages are threaded for connection to fluid sources.
    * Flow restricting devices are included to manage fluid rates.
    * Made from durable materials like stainless steel.

* Valve Operation Mechanism
    * Elongated valve member directs fluid flow to the outlet.
    * Sealing sleeves prevent fluid leakage and commingling.
    * Rotational movement of the valve adjusts fluid proportions.
    * Check valves may be included to prevent backflow.

* Fluid Mixing Process
    * The valve allows for continuous adjustment of fluid ratios.
    * Maximum flow rates occur only when aligned with respective passages.
    * The design minimizes fluid demand from sources.
    * Ensures consistent fluid pressure during operation.

* Conclusion
