    * The invention provides an efficient solution for aircraft cleaning.
    * It allows for precise control over cleaning mixtures.
    * The design is adaptable for multiple users.
    * Future modifications and applications are anticipated.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a gas compression method for pipelines in frost areas.  
    • The method compresses gas to a higher pressure and cools it before transportation.  
    • The exit temperature is maintained at or below 0° C.  
    • An arrangement for implementing this method is also described.  
• Current gas transportation involves significant pressure losses requiring compressor stations.  
    • Turbo compressors driven by gas turbines are typically used.  
    • Many natural gas reserves are located in permanent frost areas.  
    • The cooling of gas is crucial to prevent thawing of the ground.  
• Conventional re-cooling plants are expensive and underutilized.  
    • They pose safety risks due to flammable cooling agents like propane.  
    • These plants are often idle for most of the year.  
    • The invention aims to reduce investment and operational risks.  
• The proposed method involves compressing gas to an excess pressure.  
    • The gas is cooled above the exit temperature before expansion.  
    • Expansion to the desired exit pressure provides additional cooling.  
    • This method allows for efficient operation during warmer months.  
• The compressor station includes multiple compressors and heat exchangers.  
    • An electronic control system manages the operation of compressors and valves.  
    • The design allows for flexibility in operation based on seasonal demands.  
    • The system can switch between summer and winter operation modes.  
• The method allows for energy recovery during gas expansion.  
    • Expansion turbines can be used to perform work and recover energy.  
    • This reduces the overall energy consumption of the compressor station.  
    • The design is adaptable to varying flow rates and environmental conditions.  
• The invention significantly lowers investment costs compared to conventional methods.  
    • It reduces the risk of accidents associated with re-cooling units.  
    • The system can operate efficiently throughout the year.  
    • The design is particularly beneficial for long-distance gas pipelines.  
</summary>

<summary>
• Electronic components generate heat that requires effective cooling methods.  
    • Free convection cooling is sometimes insufficient for heat removal.  
    • Electric fans are commonly used to enhance air movement for cooling.  
    • Cooling fans help maintain acceptable temperature ranges for components.  
• Traditional fastening methods for cooling fans increase product costs.  
    • Fasteners like screws and rivets require labor and tools for installation.  
    • Handling costs associated with fasteners also contribute to overall expenses.  
    • A new system aims to eliminate the need for these fasteners.  
    • This innovation is applicable across various industries, including automotive and electronics.  
• The cooling fan assembly integrates with a panel for effective mounting.  
    • The assembly includes a motor that drives a fan blade for air movement.  
    • It can utilize different types of motors, including electric, hydraulic, or pneumatic.  
    • Motor control components can be mounted on or separate from the motor.  
    • The assembly is designed to exhaust warm air from an enclosure.  
• The installation process of the cooling fan assembly involves multiple steps.  
    • The assembly is positioned against the panel in a load position.  
    • A compressive and rotating force is applied to secure the assembly.  
    • The assembly transitions through partially installed to fully installed positions.  
    • Resilient leg portions capture within openings to secure the assembly.  
• The design includes features to prevent disengagement and vibrational noise.  
    • Spring members urge the assembly against the panel to maintain stability.  
    • The assembly's design allows for easy installation without traditional fasteners.  
    • Modifications to the spring member design are possible without losing functionality.  
    • The invention aims to simplify cooling fan installation while reducing costs.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
	* * Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials for efficiency.
	* * Lightweight composites have low inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels.
	* * 14% of launches through 1984 experienced vibration-related failures, with 50% resulting in mission loss.

* Need for Vibration Reduction Techniques
	* * Current graphite structure modifications may not sufficiently reduce vibration.
	* * Additional techniques are necessary for instruments if structural reductions are inadequate.
	* * Kinematic mounts (KMs) have limited damping, amplifying flight loads on instruments.

* Objectives of the Invention
	* * Introduce kinematic mounts with novel damping features.
	* * Provide passive energy dissipation mechanisms to protect instruments.
	* * Simplify manufacturing by using six identical strut elements.

* Damped Instrument Kinematic Mount Design
	* * The design incorporates damping materials to reduce high energy disturbances.
	* * Damping mechanisms are placed at flexural hinge locations to enhance performance.
	* * Two preferred embodiments of dampers are presented: spherical and cylindrical slot dampers.

* Spherical Damper Design
	* * Composed of two partial shells with a viscoelastic damping layer.
	* * Deforms under launch loads, dissipating vibration energy as heat.
	* * Frequency-dependent properties allow for effective damping during flight.

* Cylindrical Slot Damper Design
	* * Utilizes o-rings within slots around flexural hinges.
	* * Induces compression/tension in the damping material for energy dissipation.
	* * Provides significant performance improvement over untreated mounts.

* Alternative Damped Kinematic Mount Concepts
	* * Truss structures may be used for efficient stiffness-to-weight ratios.
	* * Damped versions of existing mount configurations can be implemented.
	* * A classical arrangement pattern for mounts is proposed for clarity.

* Benefits of the Proposed Mounting Concept
	* * Simplifies design by using identical strut elements.
	* * Allows for nearly uncoupled suspension modes for dynamic stability.
	* * Enhances performance for instruments with rotating parts or dynamic disturbances.

* Conclusion
	* * The invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts for instrument protection.
	* * Various changes and equivalents can be made without departing from the invention's scope.
	* * The proposed designs aim to improve the reliability and functionality of space instruments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to large oil shear type clutch units, particularly for aircraft catapult systems.
	* It aims to improve coupling forces, control accuracy, and reduce residual drag compared to prior art.
* The clutch unit features interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment.
	* This design minimizes residual drag and allows for easier replacement of clutch disc segments without full disassembly.
* The system includes a servo control valve and fluid amplifiers to manage fluid pressure and flow rates for precise control.
	* The auxiliary fluid supply not only aids in retraction of the clutch plates but also serves as a coolant for the discs.
* Key advantages of the invention include enhanced cooling, reduced friction, and the ability to inspect and replace components conveniently.
	* The design eliminates the need for retraction springs, relying instead on centrifugal force to minimize drag.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an internal combustion engine design that incorporates both combustion and expansion cylinders.
	*	* The system aims to improve thermal efficiency by utilizing exhaust gases and water injection to drive expansion cylinders, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
	*	* Features include catalytic materials for exhaust purification and mechanisms for water recovery and reuse within the engine system.

* Various configurations of cylinders and gearing systems are proposed to optimize engine performance.
	*	* The design allows for multiple stages of expansion, with larger displacement expansion cylinders receiving exhaust from smaller combustion cylinders.
	*	* The arrangement can include both two-stroke and four-stroke cylinders, with options for gear reductions to synchronize operations.

* The engine aims for high thermal-to-mechanical efficiency, significantly reducing heat loss compared to traditional engines.
	*	* The final exhaust temperature is targeted to be low, minimizing thermal waste and maximizing useful energy output.
	*	* The system is adaptable to various fuel types and combustion methods, enhancing its applicability in different environments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating coated steel plates intended for welding and heat treatment.
	* The goal is to achieve parts with high mechanical strength and corrosion resistance, particularly for automotive applications.

* The method involves removing a metal alloy layer from the precoated steel plates before welding.
	* This removal prevents the formation of intermetallic areas that can lead to mechanical failure in welded joints.

* The invention provides specific parameters for the composition of the steel and the thickness of the intermetallic alloy layer.
	* The steel composition includes controlled amounts of carbon, manganese, silicon, and boron to optimize mechanical properties.

* The resulting welded blanks undergo heat treatment to form a protective intermetallic alloy compound.
	* This process enhances corrosion resistance and maintains the mechanical integrity of the welded parts.
</summary>

    • It utilizes GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites for real-time data.

• The mobile structure can include various energy recovery systems, such as hydrokinetic turbines or wind turbines.  
    • It can operate autonomously or under human supervision.  
    • The design allows for flexibility in energy extraction methods.  
    • The system can adapt to different weather patterns and environmental conditions.  
• The invention includes detailed communication and control mechanisms.  
    • It employs microprocessor systems for control and communication within the mobile structure.  
    • The system features various sensors for monitoring and adjusting operations.  
    • Wireless communication methods are utilized for data transmission between the mobile structure and the central facility.  
• The GUI provides operators with critical information and control options.  
    • It displays real-time data on position, heading, and energy extraction efficiency.  
    • Operators can adjust navigation parameters and control settings through the GUI.  
    • The GUI supports multiple workstations for enhanced operational oversight.  
• The invention emphasizes safety and efficiency in energy recovery operations.

    • The SCADA system enhances the economic feasibility of energy extraction from severe weather patterns.  
    • It allows for predictive modeling to optimize energy recovery strategies.

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a rolling body guide cage.
	* It is made from at least one ring element and multiple guide structures for rolling bodies.
	* A method for manufacturing this guide cage is also described.
* Prior art includes a ball bearing cage from DE 1 625 540 A1.
	* This cage consists of two identical axially profiled ring elements.
	* It suffers from significant material waste during production.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs for rolling body guide cages.
	* This is achieved by using a ring element made from flat material ring segments.
	* The segments are joined and welded before axial profiling is formed.
* The design allows for reduced cutting waste during manufacturing.
	* Particularly beneficial for ring elements with an internal diameter over 140 mm.
	* The process costs are lower than the material costs from cutting waste.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably 120° segments.
	* They can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.
	* Only three weld points are needed to join the segments into a ring element.
* The method includes welding the segments using laser or pressure welding.
	* This creates strong weld points with minimal distortion.
	* The segments can be pre-formed or cut to final dimensions before welding.
* The invention is applicable for both radial and axial bearing cages.
	* It allows for mirror-symmetrical assembly of structurally identical ring elements.
	* Weld points are offset to enhance structural integrity.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for improving customer service in telecommunications by utilizing global satellite positioning to accurately identify service locations and provide efficient routing for service technicians.  
	* The system includes a technician input device, a technician server, and a GPS system to obtain and store latitude and longitude coordinates associated with customer service locations.  

* The methods also encompass generating driving directions for technicians traveling between service locations, enhancing response times and reducing errors in locating customers.  
	* A mapping system processes coordinates to provide travel directions, ensuring technicians can efficiently navigate to multiple service locations.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields.
	* It utilizes two triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils.
	* The control unit processes signals to protect an object from interfering fields.

* The system addresses challenges in measuring and compensating both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
	* It employs a virtual sensor to simulate measurements at the object's location.
	* Feedback effects between adjacent compensation systems are managed through a cross-coupling matrix.

* The control algorithm allows for flexibility in handling different interference scenarios.
	* It can adapt to changes in control tasks without requiring extensive recalibration.
	* Nonlinear control algorithms can be implemented for improved compensation performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating biological samples using CARS microscopy.  
	• It utilizes coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering to generate resonance signals from the sample.  
• The method improves upon existing CARS microscopy techniques by introducing resonance sites through bioorthogonal reactions.  
	• This allows for enhanced detection of structures that may not naturally possess resonance sites.  
• CARS microscopy employs two lasers to create a CARS spectrum, enhancing light yield and reducing background noise.  
	• The method can achieve three-dimensional imaging without the need for additional tagging or dyes.  
• Bioorthogonal reactions are defined as chemical reactions that occur in living systems without disrupting natural processes.  
	• These reactions can introduce functional groups into biological samples for improved visualization.  
• The invention allows for the selective tagging of specific structures within a sample, enhancing imaging capabilities.  
	• This is particularly useful for analyzing complex biological tissues, such as nerve tissue.  
• The method can utilize various bioorthogonal reactions, including cycloadditions and Staudinger ligation.  
	• These reactions can be performed in aqueous environments at room temperature, making them suitable for live cells.  
• The approach aims to provide a reproducible background signal in CARS microscopy, improving quantitative analysis.  
	• This is achieved by actively introducing defined resonance sites to counteract non-resonant backgrounds.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The application claims benefit from a prior provisional application.  
    • The provisional application was filed on May 30, 2008.  
    • It is incorporated by reference in the current application.  

• The invention relates to medical equipment for radiation therapy.  
    • It focuses on accurately controlling radiation dosage and placement.  
    • The goal is to destroy tumors while minimizing damage to surrounding tissue.  

• External source radiation therapy is used to treat internal tumors.  
    • Radiation sources include linear accelerators and radioisotopes.  
    • Treatment typically involves multiple beams from different angles.  

• Advanced radiation delivery modalities have been developed.  
    • These modalities customize treatment plans to conform doses to target regions.  
    • Techniques include beamlet modulation and robotic arms delivering beams.  

• Treatment plans are based on digitized virtual models of patient anatomy.  
    • Volumetric medical imaging techniques like CT and MRI are used.  
    • Segmentation of tumor and sensitive areas is performed for treatment planning.  

• Segmentation can be done manually or through automatic programs.  
    • Various commercial software options are available for segmentation.  
    • Results are stored in DICOM-RT Structure Set files.  

• The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations.  
    • It compares clinician-approved segmentations with those from trainees or software.  
    • The comparison identifies missing or extra volume elements.  

• The apparatus uses electronic files to generate volume models for comparison.  
    • It outputs a measure of conformance between different segmentations.  
    • The system can be used for quality assurance of autosegmentation routines.  

• The program allows for customizable metric methods for evaluation.  
    • Users can define parameters for assessing segmentation quality.  
    • The output includes visual representations of common, missing, and extra volumes.  

• The invention aids in training clinicians and evaluating autosegmentation systems.  
    • It can assess changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy.  
    • The system is adaptable for various applications in radiation therapy planning.  
</summary>

<summary>
• Related U.S. Patent Applications
    • • Two patent applications related to floating point operations are mentioned.
    • • Inventors include Sridhar Samudrala, Victor Peng, Nachum M. Gavrielov, and Vijay Maheshwari.
    • • Both applications are assigned to the same assignee as the present invention.

• Background of the Invention
    • • The invention pertains to data processing systems and floating point operations.
    • • Floating point format allows manipulation of a wide range of numerical quantities.
    • • Addition and subtraction in floating point format are complex and time-consuming.

• Need for Acceleration
    • • The complexity of floating point operations necessitates a need for faster execution.
    • • The invention aims to improve the efficiency of effective subtraction operations.
    • • It proposes using a subset of signals from operand exponent arguments for acceleration.

• Features of the Invention
    • • Improved apparatus for executing floating point operations is provided.
    • • Techniques for accelerating effective subtraction operations are introduced.
    • • The invention allows starting subtraction procedures before complete exponent differences are available.

• Summary of the Invention
    • • The invention includes apparatus for determining differences in operand exponent arguments.
    • • Subset differences are calculated to initiate subtraction of operand fractions.
    • • The correct result can be derived from available operand fractions when needed.

• Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    • • The effective subtraction operation is divided based on the absolute value of exponent differences.
    • • Different procedures are outlined for cases where the absolute difference is greater or less than one.
    • • The preferred embodiment includes specific techniques for accelerating computation.

• Apparatus Implementation
    • • A block diagram illustrates the apparatus for executing the preferred embodiment.
    • • The apparatus includes subtraction units and logic units for processing exponent differences.
    • • Control signals determine the final fraction result based on the calculated differences.

• Operation of the Preferred Embodiment
    • • The invention accelerates effective subtraction by calculating subset differences.
    • • This allows for early initiation of operations involving operand fractions.
    • • The final result can be determined more quickly by leveraging available operand fractions.

• Conclusion
    • • The description illustrates the operation of the preferred embodiment.
    • • The scope of the invention is defined by the claims that follow.
    • • Variations in implementation are possible while remaining within the spirit of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>

	• • Continuation-in-part of U.S. Patent application Ser. No. 07/790,516

	• • Particularly applicable to display holograms and spatial light modulators

<summary>
• Invention Overview
    • This invention pertains to testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines.
    • Focuses on squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
    • Aims to identify rotor defects through resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew measurements.
    • Addresses the need for economical and reliable testing methods.

• Background and Challenges
    • Squirrel cage rotors are mass-produced but can have defects.
    • Common issues include porosity in aluminum and poor insulation.
    • Expensive tests on every rotor are not feasible due to infrequent quality problems.
    • Low-cost tests are necessary for quality control before rotor assembly.

• Prior Art Limitations
    • Existing methods often require stator cores or are destructive.
    • Some non-destructive techniques require extensive operator training.
    • Other methods cannot separately determine resistance, reactance, and skew.
    • There is a need for improved non-destructive testing methods.

• Objectives of the Invention
    • Provide a novel method for non-destructive testing of rotors.
    • Enable economical measurement of resistance and reactance.
    • Allow for effective skew measurement of rotors.
    • Facilitate automatic pass/fail determinations for quality control.

• Test Apparatus Description
    • The apparatus includes a test head for rotor testing.
    • Features exciting means for magnetizing the rotor.
    • Voltage and current sensing means generate signals for analysis.
    • Processing means calculates resistance, reactance, and skew.

• Testing Process
    • The rotor is rotated within the test head during testing.
    • Data acquisition occurs through synchronized sampling of signals.
    • The system processes data to determine rotor characteristics.
    • Results are compared against predetermined thresholds for quality assessment.

• Statistical Analysis and Reporting
    • The system stores statistical data for multiple tests.
    • Provides averages, standard deviations, and pass/fail results.
    • Results can be displayed and printed for operator review.
    • Enhances quality control through detailed statistical evaluations.

• Mechanical Structure
    • The test fixture includes a retraction and drive mechanism.
    • A spindle securely holds the rotor during testing.
    • A clutch mechanism ensures the rotor is held in place.
    • The design allows for easy rotor placement and secure testing.
</summary>

<summary>
* Mobile devices are increasingly powerful, prompting the need for secure application development.
	* Providers often restrict access to hardware and software to protect against attacks.
	* There is a demand for methods that allow third-party applications while maintaining security.

* The disclosure outlines methods for managing access to native resources through digital certificates.
	* Managed libraries can be granted access based on validated certificates, while managed applications may be denied access.
	* A manager component is responsible for authorizing requests and ensuring compliance with security protocols.

* The operational procedures include verifying executables and managing application permissions.
	* Applications are packaged with digital signatures to ensure authenticity and prevent unauthorized access.
	* The system employs an arbitration layer to control interactions between managed applications and the operating system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on a novel implementation of a FIFO queue in functional memories.
	* It utilizes a tree-shaped structure to reduce the amount of data copying required during updates.
	* Updates involve copying only the path from the root to the update point, leading to logarithmic time complexity.
	* The structure maintains leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level, creating a balanced tree.

* A header node is introduced to enhance the efficiency of additions and deletions in the queue.
	* The header node contains pointers to the beginning and end of the queue, as well as the tree structure.
	* This allows for faster updates, as most additions can be done in constant time.
	* The queue can be inverted by changing a bit in the header node, allowing for flexible operations.

* The tree structure ensures that all leaf nodes are at the same level and internal nodes are full.
	* Additions fill non-full leaf nodes first, maintaining balance in the tree.
	* Deletions occur from the rightmost leaf node, ensuring efficient memory management.
	* The structure can also function as a double-ended queue (deque) by interpreting the header node differently.

* The memory arrangement includes registers and control logic to manage the queue operations.
	* Intermediate registers store the current leaf nodes for efficient access during additions and deletions.
	* The control logic handles the copying and updating of nodes in the tree structure.
	* The design allows for separate storage of records, optimizing memory usage.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on developing embedded EPROM devices using existing integrated circuit technologies.  
		• The goal is to create EPROM devices compatible with DRAM redundancy circuits and standard logic technologies.  
		• These devices aim to eliminate the need for high voltages during programming and erasing operations.  
		
• Current EPROM devices are limited by their manufacturing processes and high voltage requirements, making them impractical for integration with DRAM and logic circuits.  
		• Existing EPROM technologies require specialized manufacturing steps, increasing costs and complexity.  
		• The use of fuses in DRAM redundancy circuits is destructive and cumbersome, highlighting the need for a more efficient solution.  
		
• The proposed EPROM devices utilize DRAM storage capacitors and transistor properties under stress to achieve programmability.  
		• This approach allows for higher capacitance and reduced operational voltages compared to traditional EPROM devices.  
		• The invention also introduces SEPROM devices that leverage hot carrier effects and gate voltage stress for data storage, suitable for embedded applications.  
</summary>

<summary>
* Overview of Feedback Control
	* * Feedback control is used to guide automatic vehicles along a predetermined path.
	* * It involves detecting errors, calculating corrections, and adjusting steering repeatedly.
	* * Various systems (P, PI, PD, PID) use different methods to calculate correction amounts based on feedback gains.

* Challenges in Determining Feedback Gains
	* * The values of feedback gains (P, I, D) significantly affect control characteristics.
	* * Traditional methods, like the limit sensitivity process, can be difficult to implement practically.
	* * Accurate detection of self-sustaining vibrations is often challenging in real-time applications.

* Proposed Method for Feedback Gain Determination
	* * The invention provides a systematic method to determine feedback gains quickly and accurately.
	* * It involves iterative steps of provisional gain setting, error detection, and evaluation value calculation.
	* * The method allows for the determination of optimal gains irrespective of the control subject.

* Implementation in Automatic Guidance Vehicles (AGVs)
	* * The method is applied to AGVs, with specific routines for determining P, I, and D gains.
	* * Evaluation functions are used to assess the stability, accuracy, and response of control.
	* * The process can be executed continuously or in sections, adapting to different running conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to zoom lenses with enhanced relative aperture and optical performance.
	* * Aims to minimize physical size while maintaining high-grade imagery for cameras.
* There is a demand for zoom lenses that balance high relative aperture and reduced bulk.
	* * Particularly important for video cameras with low sensitivity image pickup elements.
* Current video cameras utilize 2/3 inch image pickup tubes for compactness and quality.
	* * 8 mm video cameras are increasingly using smaller 1/2 inch image pickup tubes.
* The design of a 4-unit zoom lens can achieve a relative aperture of 1.4-1.6.
	* * This requires specific design rules for the lens units to correct aberrations.
* Reducing the size of the first lens unit can shorten the total lens length.
	* * However, this may increase the F-number, necessitating careful design of the image forming section.
* Strengthening the refractive power of lens units can lead to increased aberrations.
	* * This complicates achieving the desired optical performance.
* Prior art indicates that total lens length for 2/3 inch systems is typically 10φA to 12φA.
	* * Achieving lengths shorter than 10φA while maintaining performance has been challenging.
* The invention proposes a zoom lens with a small F-number and high zoom ratio.
	* * It includes specific lens unit configurations to ensure good aberration correction.
* Conditions for lens design are outlined to optimize performance across the zoom range.
	* * These include ratios of refractive power and Abbe numbers for lens materials.
* The invention significantly reduces the total length of zoom lenses to 9.13φA to 9.19φA.
	* * This advancement is particularly beneficial for photographic and video cameras.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles.
	* The method generates a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through, converting it into an electric signal for recording or display.
* The device includes a detector and amplification devices for processing signals.
	* It features a fast amplifier for individual signals and a slow amplifier for integrating multiple signals.
* Current methods struggle to detect both individual particles and integrate signals simultaneously.
	* The invention aims to overcome these limitations without prior knowledge of expected signal rates.
* The method involves discharging charge pulses on the low-voltage side of the detector.
	* This approach improves the signal-to-noise ratio and simplifies the detection of small signals.
* The device allows for the separation of signals based on their rates using capacitors and inductive elements.
	* This enables simultaneous detection of individual signals and integration of multiple signals.
* The invention proposes using materials like diamond for fast charge transport at room temperature.
	* Such materials enhance detection capabilities across a wide range of signal rates.
* The method and device can be applied in various fields, including particle accelerators and medical diagnostics.
	* They facilitate both individual particle detection and integration for improved measurement accuracy.
* The design includes features to prevent interference from leakage currents in high-voltage cables.
	* This ensures reliable measurements and maintains detector functionality at high ionization rates.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to an automatic apparatus for spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.  
	• The apparatus aims to improve efficiency and reduce manual operations in testing.  
	• Clutches connect rotational power sources to mechanisms like transmissions.  
	• The driven disc assembly is crucial for engaging and disengaging the clutch.

<summary>

	* The application is titled “Contourlet Appearance Model.”
* The invention relates to image processing, specifically face age-estimation.
	* It addresses challenges in accurately estimating age from facial images.
* Face age-estimation is important for various applications, including security and business.
	* It helps prevent underage access to restricted products and services.
* Aging of human faces is influenced by controllable and uncontrollable factors.
	* Factors include gender, ethnicity, environment, and lifestyle choices.
* The invention includes methods for face age-estimation and face age-progression.
	* It utilizes unique information extraction from images for accurate results.
* The disclosure describes a method using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm.
	* This method generates feature vectors for age classification.
* Machine-readable instructions are provided for implementing the age-estimation methods.
	* These instructions include steps for feature extraction and age mapping.
* The training process involves a database of images with assigned landmark points.
	* Feature extraction is performed using the CAM algorithm to create training data.
* Support Vector Regression (SVR) and Support Vector Machines (SVM) are used for classification.
	* These techniques help distinguish between different age groups.
* The system can be implemented on various computing devices for real-time age estimation.
	* It includes components for processing images and generating age estimates.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention includes specific configurations for pixel arrangements.

    * The controller can manage light intensity signals for optimal display.
    * The arrangement can be adapted for different types of images, such as monochrome or colored.

* Practical applications of the device are highlighted through examples.
    * It can combine images from night vision sensors with graphical overlays.

    * The design allows for flexibility in handling different image resolutions and refresh rates.

<summary>
* Imaging devices, such as xerographic machines, enter a "sleep mode" to conserve energy when inactive for extended periods.
    * The device warms up and performs imaging operations upon waking.
    * Toner used in these devices is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge.
    * A toner concentration sensor adjusts the supply of toner based on its concentration.
    * Inactivity can lead to a decrease in toner charge, affecting image quality.

* Various methods and apparatuses are proposed to charge toner based on periods of inactivity.
    * These methods involve determining inactivity periods and measuring toner charge levels.
    * The charging process aims to restore toner charge to a predetermined level.
    * An intelligent system monitors user patterns to predict usage and adjust toner charging accordingly.
    * The system includes components for measuring, calculating decay, and updating usage patterns.

* Flowcharts illustrate methods for charging toner in imaging devices.
    * The first method involves predicting user usage and calculating toner decay after inactivity.
    * The second method measures toner charge levels before and after the device becomes active.
    * Both methods aim to ensure toner is adequately charged for optimal printing quality.
    * The implementation can be achieved through software or hardware solutions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to a high-precision recording/reproducing apparatus using magneto resistive (MR) heads.  
    • The apparatus allows for precise control of bias currents for multiple MR heads.  
    • It is particularly designed for rotary magnetic head systems.  
• MR heads require both detecting and bias currents for optimal performance.  
    • The bias current maintains the operating point in a linear region.  
    • Control signals for these currents are typically transmitted via rotary transformers.  
• The invention aims to simplify the structure while allowing independent regulation of bias currents.  
    • A control signal generator is placed on the stationary side.  
    • A decoder and current supply circuit are located on the rotary drum side.  
• The apparatus can switch between multiple MR heads efficiently.  
    • Control data for switching is prioritized over other data.  
    • This ensures timely head switching and optimal current settings.  
• Various embodiments illustrate different configurations of the apparatus.  
    • Some integrate regenerative amplifiers with current supply circuits.  
    • Others feature multiple recording and reproducing heads for enhanced data transfer.  
• The design minimizes signal crosstalk and improves reliability.  
    • Rotary transformers are used to separate power, control, and data signals.  
    • This configuration reduces the number of required channels.  
• The invention is applicable beyond rotary magnetic head systems.  
    • It can also be used in disk apparatuses and with analog signals.  
    • The approach is beneficial for any system requiring precise control of multiple heads.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects like pipes and cables.
	• It addresses challenges when a second object is adjacent to the first, complicating detection.

• Prior art techniques include passive and active methods for locating buried metallic objects.
	• Passive methods use magnetic locators, while active methods induce currents in non-ferrous objects.

• The MAC-51B Magnetic and Cable Locator can operate in both active and passive modes.
	• It effectively traces cables unless adjacent objects distort the output signal.

• The invention improves the ease and accuracy of locating one concealed object in the presence of another.
	• It employs a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in adjacent objects.

• The method involves producing distinguishable alternating currents and sensing their associated magnetic fields.
	• The receiver generates an output signal based on the sensing of both fields.

• The system can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, enhancing traceability.
	• This allows for easier and more accurate location and tracing compared to prior systems.

• Various techniques are used to distinguish the currents in the respective cables.
	• These include using different carrier frequencies or amplitude modulation.

• The transmitter's optimal positioning relative to the cables is crucial for effective operation.
	• Adjustments can be made based on initial tracing results to improve signal clarity.

• The invention is particularly effective when the horizontal separation between cables is less than a certain ratio to their depth.
	• This positioning enhances the inducement of currents and improves receiver performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network for hands-free automatic answering.
	• The system includes a timer for controlling call duration and a bypass switch for extending calls.
  
• Existing systems primarily focus on telephone communication, while this invention aims to enhance accessibility for physically handicapped individuals and those engaged in hands-on tasks.
	• The modular design allows for easy relocation and installation at various telephone jack locations.

• Two embodiments of the interfacing apparatus are described: one using an optically coupled circuit and another using a neon lamp with a photocell.
	• Both embodiments feature automatic answering capabilities and adjustable timing for call duration.

• The detailed circuit diagrams illustrate the electronic and electromechanical implementations of the interfacer device.
	• Components and values for constructing the preferred embodiments are provided for practical application.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on optical fiber communications, specifically trunk and branch network design.  
    • The system aims to enhance undersea lightwave communications.  
    • It addresses the need for multipoint-to-multipoint connectivity.  
    • The design aims to maintain connectivity despite cable cuts.  
• A ring topology is proposed to improve network survivability.  
    • This configuration allows for continued operation despite single cable cuts.  
    • It isolates only affected branches during multiple branch cuts.  
    • The design supports robust communication even in fault scenarios.  
• The invention seeks to reduce the need for undersea optical repeaters.  
    • It replaces conventional repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers.  
    • Energy is supplied through the same branch cables used for communication.  
    • This approach aims to lower capital and operational costs.  
• The system includes telecommunications hubs and branching units.  
    • Hubs serve as access points for routing communications.  
    • Branching units facilitate add/drop points for traffic management.  
    • The design allows for flexible network configurations.  
• The optical amplifiers are strategically placed within the network.  
    • They utilize energy from light sources at distinct wavelengths.  
    • The system supports wavelength-division-multiplexing (WDM) technology.  
    • Amplifiers enhance signal strength without traditional repeaters.  
• The invention is adaptable for both undersea and terrestrial applications.  
    • It can be modified for various signal multiplexing methods.  
    • The design is not limited to specific wavelengths or configurations.  
    • Future advancements may further improve system capabilities.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wiring devices in ganged boxes.
    * It aims to prevent unwanted access and provide a finished look without visible fasteners.
    * The device consists of two parts: an attachment member and a cover plate member.
    * The design accommodates uneven wall surfaces and allows for easy installation and removal.
    * The cover plate has no visible fasteners, enhancing safety and aesthetics.

* The attachment member is mounted to the wiring device and features latching pawls.
    * The cover plate engages with these pawls using saw-tooth shaped racks.
    * A tab on the attachment member allows for easy removal of the cover plate.
    * The system is designed to work with various configurations of wiring devices.
    * The arrangement can cover one to four wiring devices, adapting to different installations.

* The invention addresses issues found in prior art regarding exposed fasteners and installation difficulties.
    * It eliminates the risk of shock hazards associated with exposed screws.
    * The design allows for independent operation of the latching mechanism for better fit.
    * The cover plate can be adjusted to follow the contour of the wall.
    * The invention is suitable for both residential and commercial applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for screens.
	* It aims to improve visibility by reducing reflections on displays like televisions and monitors.
* The known device has disadvantages, including the need for a special fastening device.
	* This results in increased costs and an unattractive appearance for the screen housing.
* The new design features concentric annular strips that can slide over one another.
	* This allows the device to fold into a compact size when not in use.
* The light-shielding device can be easily attached using Velcro.
	* It can accommodate various screen shapes, including flat and curved monitors.
* The strips have decreasing wall thickness, enabling flexible positioning.
	* Users can view the screen from different angles without obstruction.
* The device includes hooks and locking elements for secure operation.
	* An adapter member provides a flat attachment face for versatile compatibility.
* The design is cost-effective, reliable, and consists of minimal parts.
	* It can be produced through injection molding or bending plate material.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the challenge of non-native listeners struggling to comprehend rapid speech from native speakers.
	* A device automatically detects the speaker's rate of speech and compares it to a listener's comprehension threshold.
	* The device notifies the speaker to slow down when their speaking rate exceeds the threshold, using various sensory mechanisms.

* The system can adapt to different languages and listener proficiencies, enhancing communication effectiveness.
	* It includes features for identifying the language of discourse and assessing listener proficiency to set appropriate speaking rate thresholds.
	* The device can be integrated into wearable technology or telecommunication systems, providing real-time feedback during conversations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a device for optical recording of rapid processes using a TV camera.  
	• It allows for high and selectable time resolution in recordings.  
	• The device includes means for beam deviation and suppression to scan over N lines.  
 
• Conventional TV cameras operate at 25 Hz, limiting their ability to capture fast phenomena.  
	• High-speed cameras are expensive and rely on photochemical recording.  
	• The invention aims to provide a cost-effective solution with improved recording capabilities.  

• The device features a cyclic line counter and a sawtooth generator for beam control.  
	• The counter counts line pulses and generates an end-of-count pulse for beam suppression.  
	• The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the counter output for vertical deviation.  

• A programmable counter allows for flexibility in the number of lines scanned.  
	• The ratio of total lines to counted lines (N/p) is an integer greater than 1.  
	• This enables adjustments to optimize time resolution based on the process speed.  

• The system can achieve a picture repeat frequency significantly higher than conventional methods.  
	• For example, scanning 8 lines can increase the frequency to approximately 2000 sec⁻¹.  
	• The spatial resolution is maintained in the line direction while reduced vertically.  

• The recorded video signals can be digitized for analysis rather than immediate optical representation.  
	• Gaps in the recorded lines can be filled through interpolation or repetition of previous lines.  
	• This method allows for the analysis of rapid processes without the need for expensive film cameras.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on multimedia communications, particularly for integrating multimedia calls with legacy phone systems.  
    • The telecommunications industry is rapidly evolving, with increasing consumer demand for multimedia features.  
    • Businesses and residential consumers alike seek enhanced multimedia services for coordination and communication.  
    • Existing approaches often require costly upgrades to network equipment, which is not optimal for users with functioning legacy systems.  
• The invention proposes a solution for integrating voice and multimedia calls into a single session, termed a "blended call."  
    • A multimedia server works in conjunction with a telephony server to manage these blended calls.  
    • The system determines if the recipient supports blended capabilities before routing calls appropriately.  
    • The "blender" software facilitates the integration of voice and multimedia components within a single communication session.  
• The methodology includes handling both incoming and outgoing calls with blended capabilities.  
    • Incoming calls are processed by checking the recipient's capabilities and routing to the multimedia server if supported.  
    • Outgoing calls similarly verify the caller's capabilities before initiating blended call components.  
    • The system utilizes SIP-T for effective communication and session management.  
• The architecture includes telephony servers, multimedia servers, and databases to track client capabilities.  
    • Telephony servers manage voice calls, while multimedia servers handle multimedia components.  
    • The database servers store information about which clients support blended services.  
    • The system is designed to maintain compatibility with existing network devices and protocols.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to content synchronization frameworks for connected devices.
	* * It addresses limitations in existing data synchronization methods, such as predefined attributes and lack of bundling.
* Existing synchronization methods struggle with arbitrary attribute prioritization and data set distribution.
	* * They also lack mechanisms for resuming synchronization after connection disruptions.
* The proposed method involves a central reference point that processes synchronization requests from client devices.
	* * It constructs responses that include prioritized bundles of files for download.
* The framework supports dynamic attributes that change over time, enhancing content relevance.
	* * It employs data compression and priority-based downloading to optimize bandwidth usage.
* Client devices create a delta list to identify files that need updating based on local copies.
	* * This list retains the download priority assigned by the central reference point.
* The synchronization process allows for the rejection of incomplete bundles and resumption of downloads.
	* * It ensures that inter-file dependencies are maintained by rejecting incomplete bundles.
* The framework is scalable, as much of the processing is handled by client devices.
	* * This reduces the need for the central server to store the state of each client.
* The synchronization response includes bundles with properties that guide client actions post-download.
	* * These properties may include file locations, download priorities, and actions to perform after downloading.
* The system can cache responses to improve efficiency for repeated requests with similar attributes.
	* * This caching capability enhances scalability and reduces response times.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method and system for communication between finders and owners of lost objects.
	*	* It addresses the challenges of returning lost items while maintaining owner privacy.
	*	* The system allows for anonymous communication through unique identifiers (IDs).
	*	* It aims to facilitate timely returns of lost possessions.

* Owners can register their contact information and associate it with unique IDs.
	*	* Tags can be affixed to various portable possessions.
	*	* Owners can access a centralized database to manage their information.
	*	* The system provides a virtual locale for finders to report found items.

* Finders can communicate with owners using the unique ID associated with the lost object.
	*	* The system allows finders to send messages without revealing their identity.
	*	* Finders can view open cases related to found items.
	*	* The communication process is designed to be straightforward and user-friendly.

* The invention incorporates various technologies, including web interfaces and messaging protocols.
	*	* It supports multiple forms of communication, such as email and instant messaging.
	*	* The system can handle incoming messages and forward them appropriately.
	*	* It ensures that real email addresses remain confidential throughout the process.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Background
    * Relates to electron multipliers in photomultipliers and particle detectors.
    * Two conventional types: discrete dynode and continuous electron multipliers.
    * Discrete dynode multipliers use stages to amplify electron cascades.
    * Continuous multipliers include channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.

* Foil Electron Multiplier Design
    * Introduces a new design using thin, in-line foils.
    * Allows incident particles and generated secondary electrons to pass through.
    * Provides position-sensitive information for applications like screens and detectors.
    * Claims advantages in gain, fabrication simplicity, cost, area coverage, and ion feedback rejection.

* Advantages Over Conventional Multipliers
    * Higher gain per multiplication stage, increasing efficiency.
    * Simpler fabrication process compared to continuous multipliers.
    * Lower cost of production, with commercial foils significantly cheaper than MCPs.
    * Robust design allows for larger areas without breaking.

* Operational Mechanism
    * Utilizes a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure.
    * Voltage applied to accelerate electrons through the foils.
    * Secondary electrons generated at each stage contribute to electron multiplication.
    * Can be used for amplification or detection of various particles.

* Gain Calculation
    * Gain modeled as a function of transmission probabilities and secondary electron yields.
    * Factors include foil thickness, applied voltage, and grid transmission.
    * Gain maximized by optimizing transmission and secondary electron emission.
    * Equations provided to describe gain behavior across multiple stages.

* Experimental Validation
    * Foil electron multiplier tested with various configurations.
    * Gain measured as a function of applied voltage.
    * Results show higher gain efficiency compared to conventional multipliers.
    * Data fits theoretical models, confirming operational principles.

* Material and Fabrication
    * Preferred foil material is carbon for its thinness and uniformity.
    * Other materials include silver, gold, and hydrocarbons.
    * Thinner foils require lower applied voltages for effective operation.
    * Supporting grids necessary for structural integrity of thin foils.

* Applications
    * Suitable for use in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors.
    * Can detect photons, ions, and electrons effectively.
    * Position-sensitive anodes can enhance detection capabilities.
    * Potential applications in night vision devices and electron spectrometers.

* Conclusion
    * Foil electron multiplier represents a significant advancement in electron multiplication technology.
    * Offers improved performance and cost-effectiveness over traditional designs

<summary>
* This application claims priority from earlier U.S. Provisional Applications.
	* It is a continuation-in-part of a previous application.
	* The entire contents of the referenced applications are incorporated by reference.

* The invention relates to motion pictures and 3-dimensional viewing systems.
	* It aims to allow effortless viewing of 2D films in 3D.
	* The system enhances viewer experience through visual effects.

* Various prior art references exist for creating 3D images from 2D sources.
	* Techniques include the use of optical elements and specialized spectacles.
	* Notable patents describe different methods for achieving 3D effects.

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope synchronizes lens filters with motion in films.
	* It calculates synchronization events in real-time without altering the film.
	* The system controls lens darkening to enhance the 3D effect.

* The invention allows viewing of any motion picture with lateral motion in 3D.
	* It works with various media formats, including film and digital.
	* The system is compatible with different viewing platforms.

* The human eye's depth perception is fundamental to the invention.
	* It utilizes principles like stereopsis and motion parallax.
	* The Pulfrich effect is key to creating the 3D illusion.

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes challenges faced by traditional 3D films.
	* It eliminates the need for special filming or projection equipment.
	* Viewer discomfort from traditional 3D glasses is reduced.

* The preferred embodiment includes lightweight glasses with controllable lenses.
	* The glasses feature a digital sensor and a processor for real-time adjustments.
	* They can adapt to various viewing conditions and media types.

* The invention has potential applications beyond just 3D viewing.
	* It can be extended to other visual effects in motion pictures.
	* Future algorithms may enhance the detection of various motion types.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers.
    • The process uses mechanical pressure to separate individual die from the wafer.
    • Trenches are formed along scribe lines on the wafer to facilitate the separation.
    • This method aims to overcome issues associated with traditional wafer saws, such as slow processing and chipping.
    
• The dicing process involves several steps to prepare the wafer for singulation.
    • A photo resist layer is applied and patterned to expose scribe lines.
    • Trenches are etched into the wafer, with depths varying based on the final thickness desired.
    • An adhesive tape is applied to the back surface of the wafer before pressure is applied.
    
• The apparatus includes a supporting pad and a mechanism to apply pressure.
    • Pressure can be applied in multiple directions to achieve a clean break along the trenches.
    • A ring may be used to hold the wafer in place during the singulation process.
    • The method is adaptable for various wafer sizes and types of semiconductor chips.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to field emission display (FED) devices with protection structures.
	* * The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes to deflect ionic emissions away from field emission components.
	* * This design aims to prevent electrical surges that can cause damage to the field emission elements.

* FED devices offer advantages over traditional liquid crystal displays (LCDs).
	* * They provide higher contrast ratios, larger viewing angles, and lower power consumption.
	* * FEDs generate their own light using colored phosphors, eliminating the need for backlighting.

* The operation of FED devices involves the emission of electrons from cathodes to phosphors.
	* * High-energy electrons strike gas molecules, creating positive ions that can damage the cathode.
	* * The proposed protection structure mitigates this risk by redirecting ions away from the cathode.

* Various configurations of reduction plates are proposed for enhanced protection.
	* * Plates can be arranged parallel to field emission elements or in a meshwork pattern.
	* * These configurations aim to maximize the deflection of harmful ions.

* The manufacturing process for FED devices is complex but can be optimized.
	* * Techniques such as photolithography and etching are used to create the necessary structures.
	* * The invention suggests methods to reduce costs and improve efficiency in fabrication.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes.
	* * It aims to address limitations of traditional CCD image sensors.
	* * The design allows for simultaneous imaging of opposing surfaces.
* Traditional CCD sensors are limited to single-plane imaging.
	* * They require separate sensors for imaging multiple surfaces, increasing complexity.
	* * Prior art includes sensors that do not utilize charge carriers effectively from edges.
* The new image sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with light-receptive edges.
	* * It features image sensor elements adjacent to these edges.
	* * Charge carriers generated by light are guided toward collection means.
* The sensor utilizes a P-type substrate with varying doping levels.
	* * A highly doped bottom layer and a lightly doped upper layer are included.
	* * This structure supports multiple imaging planes on edges and top surfaces.
* Charge carriers are effectively guided by doped layers creating a waveguide structure.
	* * This prevents loss of charge carriers and enhances collection efficiency.
	* * The design allows for continuous horizontal apertures on edge surfaces.
* A second embodiment improves charge collection and reduces crosstalk.
	* * It extends N-type regions to the edges of the sensor.
	* * This modification increases the lateral extent of the depletion region.
* The image sensor can be adapted for various applications, including color imaging.
	* * It can scan documents in a single pass using color filters.
	* * The design is compatible with existing image sensor manufacturing techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks with power management systems.  
    • The goal is to reduce energy consumption of network devices.  
    • Energy Star guidelines require devices to minimize power usage when inactive.  
    • A network master node often cannot enter power save mode while performing administrative tasks.  

• A proposed solution involves transferring administrative functions from a master node to a slave node.  
    • This allows the master node to enter a power management state.  
    • The slave node takes over the necessary network functions.  
    • This transfer can occur while the slave node performs its own functions.  

• The network is structured as a master/slave configuration.  
    • Devices can serve as either master or slave nodes.  
    • Only one device can act as the master node at a time.  
    • The master node performs administrative functions and manages network traffic.  

• The process of transferring functions includes several steps.  
    • The master node checks for network traffic before entering power save mode.  
    • It sends a transfer request to active slave nodes.  
    • The master node selects a slave node based on predetermined criteria.  

• Selection criteria for the new master node can include visibility and capabilities.  
    • Visibility refers to how many devices a slave node can communicate with.  
    • Capabilities include processing power and bandwidth.  
    • A user can also manually select the new master node.  

• The slave node must be active and not in power save mode to accept the transfer.  
    • It sends a reply to indicate acceptance of the transfer.  
    • Upon selection, it receives the administrative functions.  
    • The process is designed to be quick, often within milliseconds.  

• If no slave nodes respond, the master node may enter power save mode.  
    • If the master node fails, a slave node may self-promote to master.  
    • The network can recover from the loss of the master node.  
    • Devices check for beacons to determine network status upon activation.  

• The invention aims to optimize power consumption while maintaining network performance.  
    • It addresses the challenges of energy efficiency in home networks.  
    • The method ensures that the best-qualified device manages the network.  
    • Overall, it enhances the reliability and efficiency of home networking systems.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on antenna arrangements for measuring electromagnetic radiation direction.  
    • The goal is to determine the angle of arrival of signals.  
    • Low elevation angles are challenging due to ground reflections.  
    • Existing systems are limited by weather and frequency constraints.  

• A unique triplet arrangement of antennas is proposed.  
    • This arrangement is orthogonal to a ground plane.  
    • It allows for elevation angle measurement independent of ground reflection coefficients.  
    • The invention optimizes angle measurements over low elevation sectors.  

• The prior art is illustrated with equations from U.K. Patent No. 1449196.  
    • The equations relate to the outputs of the antenna triplet.  
    • The function S represents the essential strength of the radio signal.  
    • The quotient of specific functions is independent of several parameters.  

• The invention includes an antenna array with at least four antennas.  
    • The array features two equi-spaced linear triplets.  
    • It utilizes radio receiver means for signal processing.  
    • Logic means are used to derive signals representing elevation angles.  

• The system can operate in both receive and transmit modes.  
    • In receive mode, it provides unambiguous angle measurements.  
    • In transmit mode, signals must be coded for identification.  
    • Coherence is required within triplets but not between them.  

• The design aims for unambiguous angle measurements up to 7 degrees.  
    • Measurement accuracy is targeted at +/-0.05 degrees.  
    • The system is optimized for minimal antenna elements.  
    • The height of antennas is carefully chosen to avoid obstructions.  

• The triplet arrangement is adaptable for various applications.  
    • It can monitor aircraft elevation during landing.  
    • The system can be used in both civil and military contexts.  
    • It provides a method for determining the range and identity of objects.  

• Signal processing involves measuring the quotient of derived signals.  
    • The squared quotient is always positive and within a specific range.  
    • A timer and comparator measure decay time for signal processing.  
    • Multi-path interference effects are minimized through quick sampling.  

• The system can be integrated with secondary surveillance radar.  
    • It triggers elevation measurements based on aircraft replies.  
    • The directivity of the interrogator antenna sets coverage limits.  
    • The system ensures angles are associated with identified aircraft.  

• An alternative application involves

<summary>
• The invention focuses on high intensity, thermal efficient incandescent lamps.  
    • The design includes subminiature lamps and lamp assemblies.  
    • It aims to create a liquid tight seal for improved durability.  

• Traditional subminiature lamps use adhesives for glass envelope support.  
    • Adhesives degrade due to thermal cycling and cleaning processes.  
    • Moisture can penetrate adhesive cracks, leading to electrical failures.  

• The proposed solution replaces adhesive with a high-temperature polymer.  
    • The polymer surrounds the glass envelope, providing structural support.  
    • Fluoroelastomer is preferred for its heat resistance and chemical stability.  

• The polymeric seal support offers several advantages over traditional methods.  
    • It provides extended sealing length and increased resistance to chemicals.  
    • It allows for easier handling and installation of the lamp assembly.  

• The design minimizes the risk of burns from the lamp's metal housing.  
    • The polymeric support reduces heat conduction to the outer surface.  
    • It enhances user safety in various appliance applications.  

• The assembly process involves using potting material for stability.  
    • Potting material protects electrical leads and maintains structural integrity.  
    • It helps to create a barrier against gas penetration into the lamp.  

• The polymeric seal support allows for better centering of the lamp.  
    • It eliminates the need for adhesive, reducing off-center conditions.  
    • The design promotes a tighter fit and improved sealing performance.  

• The invention is applicable beyond medical subminiature lamps.  
    • It can be used in any application requiring high heat and chemical resistance.  
    • The techniques and materials can be adapted for various lamp designs.  

• The invention is open to modifications and improvements.  
    • Changes can be made without departing from the core principles.  
    • The patent covers all reasonable variations within the scope of the invention.  
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to MIMO communications systems, focusing on precoder configuration.
	• The GDFE precoder offers optimal capacity for MU-MIMO systems but has high computational costs.
	• Alternative precoding techniques exist, such as Block Diagonalization and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding, each with trade-offs in complexity and capacity.

• The proposed method reduces computational costs without sacrificing capacity.
	• It eliminates the need for knowledge of the covariance matrix associated with "Least Favorable Noise."
	• The method is applicable to future wireless systems, including 4G networks.

• The GDFE precoder includes components like feedforward and feedback paths, and an interference pre-cancellation block.
	• The design allows for efficient computation of filter matrices used in the precoding process.
	• The structure of the interference pre-cancellation matrix is crucial for managing interference among user terminals.

• The detailed description includes a system model with a base station and multiple user terminals.
	• The model defines various matrices, including channel gain and covariance matrices.
	• It outlines the relationships between input symbols and the transmitted signals.

• Several methods for computing GDFE precoder matrices are presented, including those that do not require the covariance matrix.
	• The methods involve QR decomposition and other matrix manipulations to derive necessary components.
	• Numerical examples illustrate the application of these methods in practical scenarios.

• The invention aims to enhance the performance of MU-MIMO systems while maintaining low computational complexity.
	• It provides a framework for real-time implementation in practical wireless communication systems.
	• The techniques described can adapt to varying channel conditions and user requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention Overview  
    • The invention focuses on a heat-dissipating device and housing, specifically an axial fan.  
    • Aims to increase intake airflow without altering assembly conditions with other components.  
    • Enhances heat-dissipating performance of the fan.  

• Background of Conventional Fans  
    • Conventional fans are used to dissipate heat from electrical components in closed housings.  
    • High temperatures can shorten the lifespan of electrical elements like CPUs.  
    • Current designs limit airflow and efficiency due to housing dimensions.  

• Objectives of the Invention  
    • To provide a fan housing that extends outward to increase airflow area.  
    • Maintain existing assembly conditions with other heat dissipation elements.  
    • Improve heat-dissipating efficiency without changing the outlet shape.  

• Design Features  
    • The housing includes an outer frame with an air passage that extends radially outward.  
    • The sidewall can be designed in various shapes, including frustum-conical.  
    • Inclined portions can be added to reduce noise and enhance airflow.  

• Impeller and Housing Integration  
    • The impeller's dimensions can increase with the housing's outward extension.  
    • The design allows for concentrated airflow towards the heat sink.  
    • The assembly can be mounted without changing existing conditions.  

• Application in Electrical Systems  
    • The heat-dissipating device can be integrated into systems with electrical elements.  
    • It effectively cools components like CPUs by directing airflow towards them.  
    • The design aims to prevent damage from overheating.  

• Summary of Benefits  
    • Enlarged air inlet and outlet areas enhance overall heat-dissipating efficiency.  
    • Increased blade dimensions lead to greater airflow and cooling capacity.  
    • The design allows for effective concentration of airflow to critical heat areas.  
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel.
    * It displays images in different colors based on usage situations.
    * The panel is particularly suitable for automobile instrument panels.
    * It aims to eliminate the need for an intermediate electrode.
    * The design allows for high luminance in daylight and comfortable green light at night.

* The display panel consists of multiple layers on a glass substrate.
    * It includes first and second electrode layers arranged in a matrix.
    * The first luminescent layer emits green light, while the second emits red or orange light.
    * The overlapping layers create single and double layer portions for color variation.
    * Voltage levels control the emitted colors, allowing for flexible display options.

* The panel can display green light at low voltage and lemon light at high voltage.
    * Green light is preferred for night-time use.
    * Lemon light is used during the day for better visibility.
    * The design reduces complexity and manufacturing costs.
    * It can also incorporate color filters for additional color options.

* Various embodiments of the display panel are described.
    * The second embodiment features square double layer portions for improved aesthetics.
    * The third embodiment includes a red color filter for mixed color display.
    * The fourth embodiment eliminates the second luminescent layer.
    * The fifth embodiment introduces thicker portions on the first luminescent layer for enhanced luminance.

* The materials and configurations can be modified for different applications.
    * Alternative luminescent materials can be used in the layers.
    * The electrode shapes can be adjusted for pattern displays.
    * The design allows for customization based on specific user needs.
    * The invention aims to provide a versatile and cost-effective display solution.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony.
    • It enables low-cost telephony by converting speech into digital data packets for transmission over the Internet.
    • The terminal supports wireless communication and does not require specialized equipment for network access.
    • It allows for dynamic IP address allocation, enhancing user mobility and ease of connection.

• The system includes a service server that manages user connections and provides additional functionalities.
    • Users can communicate via aliases, and the server tracks their online status and IP addresses.
    • The system supports various services such as news, speech mails, and chat functionalities.
    • Speech recognition capabilities can simplify user interaction with the terminal.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses the challenges of integrating high-dielectric constant oxides, particularly Pb/Bi-containing materials, with semiconductor substrates like silicon and gallium arsenide.
		• The use of a germanium buffer layer minimizes the formation of low dielectric constant layers and allows for better epitaxial growth of high-dielectric materials.
		• A stable non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer can be used as a buffer to prevent diffusion issues and enhance the overall performance of semiconductor devices.

• The proposed method involves fabricating a multi-layer structure that includes a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide on a semiconductor substrate, followed by a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide.
		• This structure can improve the capacitance and stability of memory cells and other semiconductor applications.
		• The integration of these materials can lead to advancements in non-volatile memory technologies and electrooptic applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* Receiver input circuits utilize preamplifiers and mixers with adjustable selection means.
	* * Aim to balance small and large signal behavior with low production costs.
	* * Limited dynamic characteristics of semiconductor components pose challenges.

* Previous Siemens publications detail circuits for TV tuners and FM radio receivers.
	* * Amplification control is achieved using PIN diode control networks.
	* * Control signals are derived from the intermediate frequency (IF) section.

* Existing circuits face issues with noise levels and signal distortions.
	* * Amplification control can lead to non-linearities and intermodulation distortions.
	* * Varactor diodes can cause cross modulation and relaxation oscillations under strong signals.

* The invention proposes a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops.
	* * Control signals are derived from the IF signal and other circuit stages.
	* * A third control loop has a lower response threshold and bandwidth.

* The first and second control circuits prevent overloading of the mixer stage.
	* * They ensure that unwanted signals do not distort the usable signal.
	* * The third control circuit supports the other circuits by adjusting response thresholds.

* The input circuit design includes various components for effective signal processing.
	* * PIN diodes are used for controllable signal attenuation.
	* * Rectifier circuits are arranged to minimize signal distortions.

* Further developments enhance selectivity and control range of the input circuit.
	* * Tunable selective circuits improve performance without strong attenuation.
	* * Iteration-free alignment of tuning circuits is facilitated by separate tuning voltage supplies.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on creating collaborative work environments for remote individuals.
	* It aims to simplify the setup process for collaborative sessions.
	* The system allows users to maintain voice communication while initiating collaboration.
	* It addresses the limitations of existing PC-based collaboration tools.

* The system includes a collaboration button and indicator on telephones.
	* The indicator shows when collaboration is possible between parties.
	* Activating the button launches collaboration applications on users' PCs.
	* The setup process is designed to be user-friendly for non-technical users.

* Collaboration applications can include video conferencing and document sharing.
	* The term "collaboration" refers to enhanced communication via desktop applications.
	* Applications run on PCs and can interoperate based on shared protocols.
	* The system supports both two-party and multiparty collaboration.

* The architecture allows for integration with existing telephony systems.
	* Telephones and PCs can connect through a Local Area Network (LAN) or the Internet.
	* The system can function with various telephony protocols and configurations.
	* It can also support FAX capabilities as part of the collaboration suite.

* The invention can be implemented in various forms, including software.
	* It encompasses computer programs and carrier mediums for distribution.
	* The telephone functionality can be integrated into computers.
	* Alternative embodiments are considered within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on optimizing the insertion of advertising clips into video sequences.
	* * It aims to enhance the visual impact of ads by ensuring continuity between the video content and the ads.
